Title: Data Analyst
Descriptions:
DATA ANALYST
REMOTE MUST BE IN WEST COAST/PACIFIC TIME ZONE
About Tillster
Tillster, headquartered in the USA, is the global leader in digital ordering and customer engagement solutions. For over a decade we have developed revolutionary self-service, ordering and payments solutions – for mobile, tablet, online, kiosk, call center, and more – creating personalized interactions based on consumer preferences, language, and currency. Our platform is compatible with 15+ unique POS systems, representing over 90% coverage in multi-unit restaurants. We offer one platform; one scalable, enterprise class solution – to create world-class digital engagement solutions.
Our mission and passion are one in the same: Empower restaurants and consumers to engage and transact anywhere, anytime, and from any device - one consumer at a time, one order at a time, billions of times over. In doing so, together we are transforming e-commerce in restaurants and make the till grow for Tillster and our customers.
About the Role
Tillster is seeking a Data Analyst to help transform data from our services and existing reports and Tableau dashboards into consumable data Explores and Dashboards in our platform. You will play a crucial role in enabling Data Democratization inside Tillster and with our customers - owning the implementation, improvement, and maintenance of our data products. This includes partnering and consulting with business teams to provide guidance and assistance in creating and streamlining Looker or equal style reports and underlying ETL pipelines.
What You’ll Do
Identify and implement new capabilities and best practices to develop and improve self-service and automated data analysis processes
Develop and update clear, high performing Explores and dashboards for business stakeholders such as Marketing, Product, Finance, Engineering, Account and Support/Operations
Create new Explores to enable non-technical analysts to access data, build dashboards, and solve critical business challenges on Looker technology.
Create new complex dimensions and measures for analysts to meet their business needs
Help create and maintain coding standards (style guides, etc.) and perform code reviews for other BI developers or technical analysts
Update production explores and dashboards to ensure consistent and accurate data as underlying data warehouse changes
Promote and ensure the use of a common semantic layer, data definitions, and metric calculations across all business areas.
Maintain Tillster Data infrastructure
Write SQL, build derived tables, and work with data engineering to ensure queries are performant, maintainable, and consuming cloud computing resources most efficiently
Ensure project: model: view structure is optimized to handle internal and external multi-tenant access and re-architect as needed for growing business use cases
Optimize performance through re-architecting as needed
Maintain existing data pipelines
Develop LookML in Looker.
Troubleshoot Jenkins orchestration jobs.
Modify SQL and Python code for ELT process to load data into Redshift.
About You
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative area such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience
Minimum of 1 years of experience in similar role
Excellent SQL skills
1 years of experience on AWS or Google cloud technologies (Redshift or BigQuery)
Mid to Advanced skills in Python, Looker and LookML
Knowledge of software development processes and best practices (code style guides, PR reviews, GitHub branch/merge processes, etc.)
1+ years’ experience in developing end to end business intelligence solutions, including data warehousing and business intelligence tools, techniques, and technology.
Proven analytical and quantitative skills (including ability to effectively use business tools such as Excel, Tableau, Looker) and an ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses.
Proven track record of taking ownership and of driving outcomes in a fast-paced matrix environment; history of successfully delivering large scale projects in high-quality, managing the entire life cycle
Understanding of how to write readable code and documentation
Working knowledge of agile development processes
Preferred Skills
Development experience in Tableau, PowerBI, Business Objects, MicroStrategy or other BI tools.
Previous experience building scalable BI platforms, including the use of code review processes, automated testing, staging and production environments, and release schedules is preferred
Teaching/training/consulting experience
Work experience with R, Ruby, or JavaScript (D3)
Experience with Linux/OSX command line and git
Advanced degree in a quantitative area such as Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent experience
Understanding of cloud infrastructure (AWS, Google Cloud, etc.), especially utilizing serverless technologies such as AWS Glue, AWS Lambda, etc.
The Interview Process
Recruiter interview with a Talent Acquisition Specialist
Interview with Data Analytics Team
Final interview with our VP Data
Making a Difference in the Tillster Way
Our business and product mission is to empower restaurants and consumers globally, by empowering, supporting, and nurturing the people who are part of the global Tillster team. We want to ensure all employees feel respected, confident, and engaged. Creating an inclusive working environment is of the utmost importance to us. To make this a reality, Tillster is dedicated to embracing diversity in all forms and is proudly an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, family/parental status, marital status, veteran status, disability, or any other protected status.

Pay and Benefits (USA)
Expected base salary range $80,000 - $100,000. Total starting compensation will be determined based on all lawful criteria, Company policy and best practices.
Equity: All employees within the U.S. are eligible to participate in the Stock Option Plan.
Health Benefits: All full-time, regular employees and their dependents are eligible for medical, dental, vision and FSA benefits. Additional health benefits include Healthcare and Dependent Care reimbursement programs, Employee Assistance Program (“EAP”) and Optum Care 24-hour confidential medical counseling services.
Holidays: The company observes ten (10) paid holidays per calendar year.
Paid Time Off (PTO): Full-time, regular employees earn 15 days of PTO in the first 12-months of continuous service, and 22 days in subsequent years. Eligible part-time employees earn pro-rated PTO.
Retirement: Effective with your employment start date, you will be eligible to participate in the 401(k) Plan.
Education, Learning & Development: We offer college tuition and education assistance programs; LinkedIn Learning courses; and ongoing learning and development opportunities.
Local Candidates Strongly Preferred
No Visa Sponsorship
Principals only – no Agencies or calls please
About Tillster...
Tillster is the global leader in digital ordering and customer engagement solutions. We offer one platform; one scalable, enterprise class solution – to create world-class digital engagement solutions. You will be part of a technology playground offering a fun, collaborative environment where ownership, problem solving, and teamwork are rewarded.

Title: Data Analyst
Descriptions:
Company Overview
ClearChoice was founded in 2005 to bring an innovative and patient-focused approach to solve gaps within the dental industry. We’ve experienced strong growth and today, we’re the leader in dental implant treatments. Driven by a collective desire to improve the lives of our prospective patients, we help them reclaim their health and confidence. Beyond restoring teeth, this is about getting their lives back.
This mission-focused work has enabled us to achieve four straight years of double-digit company growth, yet we’ve only reached 1% of the population that needs our services. We are searching for individuals who can help us continue pursuing our goal of reaching prospective patients and transforming their lives. When you join ClearChoice, you are joining a team of individuals with passion, conviction, and integrity whose mission is to be the platform of hope for our patients. Come help us write the next chapter of our story!
Position Summary

In this role, you’ll apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data wrangling, presentation of data, and a commercially-driven mindset to help leadership and stakeholders see beyond the numbers. You’ll be a key contributor in the analysis and synthesis of our business drivers to help optimize operational efficiency and effectiveness and fuel company growth. In this fast-paced role, you will have the opportunity to make a significant impact on customer engagement planning and strategy to drive key business outcomes.
Duties/Responsibilities
Utilize creative problem-solving and data analysis throughout all facets of our organization while working on and engaging with a team that is core to developing data-driven solutions.
Collaborate with business partners, documenting their requirements for new Data and Analytics structures that support their workflow and decision-making processes.
Lead analytics projects through the development process, collaborating with a team of data experts, ETL developers, visualization designers and Data Scientists to assure the delivery of a high-quality product.
Be accountable for your analysis generating recommended actions and for those recommendations to make a substantive impact on the business.Collaborate with the data science team on the design of data models that will satisfy business needs, drive innovation, and conform to existing design principles.
Assuring quality by continuously testing your data products while being developed and after they are deployed in production.
Required Experience and Skills
Experience establishing ongoing, effective two-way communication within the team and with business stakeholders to ensure customer satisfaction and product delivery success.
Strong experience in documenting the data requirements, data strategy, data rules then applying them (standardization, cleanse, and validation).
Proficient in scientific research applications, hypothesize and develop analytical approaches for identifying, analyzing, and interpreting trends or patterns in complex data sets
2+ years of hands-on work experience with SQL.
Proficient in one or more languages for applied to statistics, data analysis, and machine learning e.g. Python, R.
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, Azure to use/deploy analytics solutions.
2+ years of applied analytics in sales, finance, marketing, product, engineering; track record of success.
BA or BS in a quantitative field (Business, Math/Statistics, Economics, CS, Engineering, or similar). Masters in quantitative field desired.
Desired Experience
2-4 years of hands-on work experience with SQL.
3+ years of applied analytics in sales, finance, marketing, product, engineering; track record of success.
Systematic application of scientific method of problem solving & application of statistical analytic methods. (e.g. hypothesis testing, regression, classification etc.).
2+ years of data management and consulting experience.
Salary Range: 70,000 - 85,000

Please review the following job description:
Gather, analyze, document and maintain all data requirements related to the business applications, interfaces and reporting environments. Apply standards Gather, analyze, document and maintain all data requirements related to the business applications, interfaces and reporting environments. Support Data Governance across the enterprise enabling business growth while ensuring compliance with risk and regulatory expectations. The role evaluates established and emerging practices and technologies to drive the team's direction, while implementing innovative processes and solutions to provide competitive advantage. This role will partner with teams and resources across the organization to streamline and improve the overall data quality and deploy self-service data capabilities.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Following is a summary of the essential functions for this job. Other duties may be performed, both major and minor, which are not mentioned below. Specific activities may change from time to time.
Applies a comprehensive understanding of end-to-end data processes/flows and concepts to implement frameworks, processes, controls, models, and solutions to ensure data is effectively managed across the organization or within a specific business unit.
Implements data stewardship and other relevant data accountability structures across business and technology organizations to ensure data is effectively managed. Drives organizational change as necessary to implement data frameworks, processes, controls, etc. across the organization or within a given business unit.
Performs automated data quality testing of data management activities to identify areas of improvement opportunity and perspective remediation efforts. Performs testing, measures, and reports remediation efforts.
Validates the data output across the data pipelines and certifies the authenticity of the data.
Creates and implements processes and procedures associated with data quality assurance.
Implement strategic data governance capabilities by working with business and technology partners to document requirements and create action plans.
Analyzes possible solutions using experience, judgment and precedents and makes decisions within guidelines or standard practices to solve routine problems of moderate complexity. Escalates data quality issues.
Collaborate closely with peer teams to ensure coordination, synergy and seamless overall execution.
Identify data issues and work with technology, risk and business partners to triage, track, communicate, mitigate and remediate the issues to closure.
Provide subject matter expertise in the planning and execution of data management activities such as data sourcing, data lineage, and metadata management and data quality.
Drive solution design and execution of multi-pronged data governance efforts that span across platforms and business/technology areas to address enterprise data needs.
Acts as a resource for teammates with less experience. May have people management responsibilities for a small team.
Required Qualifications:
The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
1. Bachelor's degree in information technology, information systems, computer science or business-related field, six years of experience in a role of data analysis, statistical analysis, data transformation, data reconciliation and/or sophisticated data presentation or equivalent education and related training or experience
2. Experience in ETL Development using standard tools
3. Understanding of Enterprise Data Warehouse concepts and prior experience applying that understanding to query data in a Very Large Database (VLDB) environment
4. Familiarity in using a query analysis tool
Preferred Qualifications:
History of effective performance within shared service, matrix or federated environments and Internal or external consulting experience.
Experience in SQL and Unix (basic Unix commands to access database servers and lookup jobs and scripts).
Basic knowledge of any ETL languages such as Informatica PowerCenter, Abnitio and/or SAS.
Experience in process documentation, and an understanding of data flows and architectural diagrams.
Ability to interpret and present complex information to a range of audience
Ability to learn and implement new technologies and industry trends.
OTHER JOB REQUIREMENTS / WORKING CONDITIONS
Sitting
Constantly (More than 50% of the time)
Visual / Audio / Speaking
Able to access and interpret client information received from the computer and able to hear and speak with individuals in person and on the phone.
Manual Dexterity / Keyboarding
Able to work standard office equipment, including PC keyboard and mouse, copy/fax machines, and printers.
Availability
Able to work all hours scheduled, including overtime as directed by manager/supervisor and required by business need.
Travel
Minimal and up to 10%

Title: Data Analyst
Descriptions:
Job Title: Data Analyst
Reports to: VP Operations
POSITION SUMMARY
The Data Analyst is responsible for answering the business’ relevant questions through data by understanding how we store, examine and utilize data within the organization. This person will enter data into a well-designed database and interact with it using SQL for scalability and automation. Exploring different ways to analyze, manipulate, integrate and extract insights from data will be a key function in this role.
Key Duties and Responsibilities:
Create and maintain complex SQL queries to extract and manipulate data.
Design and implement efficient data storage solutions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze business requirements.
Build and maintain SQL-based reports to support business decisions.
Join data from multiple databases and tables to create comprehensive reports.
Continuously monitor and optimize query performance.
Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
Other additional and/or alternative duties as assigned.
Required Skills/Abilities:
Significant experience in SQL language and data management.
Strong understanding of SQL query optimization and performance tuning.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s Degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or related discipline.
Experience with data warehousing and ETL processes is a plus. Thrives in a fast paced environment.
2-4 years of prior experience.
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools.

Description:
The TMS Business Analyst's role is to act as the liaison between the business and IT. In this position, the TMS Business Analyst will work closely across all departments to implement, and act as ongoing continuous improvement support for, the new transportation management software. This person will be hands-on and require skills in identifying, analyzing and implementing existing and newly proposed business processes.
This BA role has three major categories of responsibilities:
Business process analysis and improvement
System setup, configuration and production support
Documentation and testing of new features and functionality
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Business process analysis and improvement.
Gather business requirements through workshops, meetings, and interviews
Document current and future system use cases and business flows
Creates technical requirements necessary to implement proposed solutions
Translates user needs into system requirements, engaging other business functions as needed
System setup, configuration and production support
Act as a subject matter expert for the setup and configuration of TMS.
Provide support for connecting to external parties via EDI
Provide ongoing support of TMS updates and new functionality.
Training/mentoring of end users on system best practices
Provide end-user Operations support for internal and external users
Capable of training others on specific areas of business processes or systems
Supporting the documentation and testing of new features and functionality
Assist with the development of system documentation, training materials, communication materials, demos, etc., in preparation for a global deployment
Assist in writing test cases and participating in SIT and UAT activities
Help to Identify and resolve data quality issues, assisting with the data management process between host systems and TMS.



Qualifications:
Business process analysis and improvement
Experience in business analysis. Ability to translate stakeholder requests into well-defined, documented use cases / requirements and review with stakeholders
Solid knowledge of the application development / configuration process.
Prior experience within transportation, logistics or supply chain
Ability to understand technical designs, specification and work to resolve changes that impact stakeholders
Experience working with EDI transaction sets for transportation carriers
Experience implementing a TMS globally
Ability to critically review and interpret technical documentation
Training/mentoring of IT/Operations Users
Strong communications skills (verbal, written, and listening)
Ability to clearly convey ideas and concepts verbally, in writing, and via presentations
Supporting the documentation and testing of new features and functionality
Ability to handle multiple priorities and consistently meet deadlines through effective time management skills
Sense of urgency with strong follow-up skills
Must be detail-oriented and able to work within a team setting
Proficient at problem solving and analytical techniques
Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with internal team members and external stakeholders
Ability to work with integrity and build trust
Education & Experience:
Bachelor's degree preferred or relevant work experience in systems or business
3+ years of transportation, logistics or supply chain
3+ years of experience working with Blue Yonder transportation systems management or implementations
Experience in a support role within Supply Chain
Experience working with EDI transactions
Experience in business process redesign
Experience in system design, testing, validation, problem resolution, and training

***Listed salary ranges may vary based on experience, qualifications, and local market. Also, some positions may include bonuses or other incentives.

Title: Data Scientist
Descriptions:
Company Description
PocketPills is a tech-driven pharmacy that is redefining pharmacy experience for consumers in Canada. Consumers can place an order on the App from the convenience of their home. We presort medications into “PocketPacks” and deliver them to the doorstep, for free. Our innovative, online pharmacy platform is aimed at significantly reducing cost, improving medication adherence and providing easy access to pharmacists. With direct access to patients’ medication history and using other healthcare information, we will predict medication adherence, medication efficacy, disease progression and incidence of new diseases by leveraging machine learning. Our addressable market is the retail pharmacy industry in Canada (~$25B annual revenues).
Job Description
The company is hiring a data scientist to drive user acquisition and retention strategies as well as impact product development with insights on user behavior and user expectations.
As a marketing data scientist, you'll be playing a key role in generating data-driven intelligence about our marketing activity’s impact on our users, optimize marketing targeting, as well as understand user lifecycle as we look to further enhance growth and deepen engagement.
Here are some of the things you would work on
Build data pipeline to create summary tables in databricks and dashboards in tableau/ redash that enhance understanding of user lifecycle and marketing performance
Take end to end ownership of building data pipelines, understanding features that impact performance, leveraging those to run marketing campaigns to test hypotheses.
Collaborate with platform engineers and product managers for data instrumentation and test various sign up flows and acquisition strategies.
Identify new opportunities for personalization to optimize marketing and increase user acquisition rates.
Keep it real with your actions, be brave with your decisions, do the right thing for users, and shape the future of the company with excitement.
Qualifications:
Quantitative background in computer science, statistics, math, or related disciplines.
Advanced knowledge of experimentation and statistical methods.
Familiarity with experimental design in the marketing world is a plus, for example, paid search, paid social, email.
5+ years of hands-on experience analyzing data at scale from inception to business impact.
Proven ability to tailor data-driven insights to business problems in a cross-functional team.
Strong programming skills (Java/Python/R + SQL)
Self-driven with the ability to work in a self-guided manner. Motivated to drive tasks to completion and take ownership of projects.
Superb communication and organization skills.
Genuinely excited about working in a startup, learning and solving problems without getting constrained by current knowledge or experience.

Title: BOM and Data Analyst
Descriptions:
About Singer :
We are passionate about creating some of the most awesome automobiles in the world. Founded in California in 2009, Singer Vehicle Design is a luxury brand with a global clientele and operations in the US, the UK, and Switzerland. Our mission is described simply as: "A Relentless Pursuit of Excellence.” The company has become renowned for its collaboration with owners of the air-cooled Porsche 911 in pursuit of bespoke restorations.
BOM & Data Analyst
:
Position Summary :
Under general supervision, the BOM and Data Analyst with the Singer team will be the interface between Engineering, Supply Chain and Operations, translating engineering requirements into actionable formats for successful execution in a manner that demonstrates, “Everything is Important.”
In this role you will be creating and updating manufacturing bills of material (mBOMs), maintaining part attribute data, and bills of process (BOPs). In addition to being responsible for BOM accuracy in our ERP system, you will also exercise skills in database research and statistical analysis to create standards for BOM cost and product/material lead-times and develop methods for quarterly review. This role involves cross-functional interaction, creativity, and problem solving to ensure the correct information is synthesized to coordinate complex activities appropriately. Familiarization with supply chain, operations, hardware, schedule, engineering specifications, and MRP/ERP/PLM and PDM systems will help to remove blockers and support the team working toward the highest priority items.

The ideal candidate will be able to work a hybrid schedule after training.
Essential Functions :
Responsible for ensuring the accuracy of demand and part master data within MRP
Responsible for part number creation, maintaining part attribute data, and creating/maintaining part lineage information
Partners with Customer Experiences, Sales, and Supply Chain to development and maintain BOMs for different options to build out successful car configurator
Engineering / PLM focal point and supports process improvement initiatives regarding part number nomenclature, part master data management, BOM management (eBOM vs mBOM), and ECO process
Creates baseline BOM standard and implement standard cost
Responsible for conducting analysis on BOM cost quarterly, root causing cost changes and providing recommendations to senior leadership.
Creates and revises planning documents (manufacturing bills of material, bills of process etc.)
Strategizes efficient methods of task execution while understanding operational impacts of all activities
Communicates frequently to assist in preparing proactive schedules to assist management in making decisions regarding execution timelines
Maintains long-term authoring projects, while at the same time addressing a stream of real-time planning requests
Develops and complies with planning release date targets
Iterative improvements to planning documents to improve quantity and quality of production data captured
Performs other duties as assigned

Minimum Qualifications:
Minimum one (1) year of experience reading technical drawings and schematics
Professional production coordination or integration experience
Proficient in Microsoft Excel

Skills/Abilities and Attributes :
Strong analytical, project management, computer, communication, and writing skills (typing, spelling, grammar)
Ability to work under deadlines in a fast-paced work environment
Ability to creatively overhaul and re-design any project or workflow to optimize comprehension, while meeting requirements
Ability to communicate and collaborate with diverse co-workers and personalities in engineering, production, and management; ability to have insight into their changing needs
Ability to quickly learn, absorb, and apply technical content to further develop understanding of assembly and testing processes
Excellent communicator, both written and verbal; ability to express ideas clearly and actively listen to others
Team oriented, with a strong ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment to meet multiple deadlines
Excellent time management with an ability to balance multiple projects and timelines
Strong organizational, problem-solving, and collaborative skills with the ability to prioritize efficiently and effectively within and across departments
Positive attitude and strong work ethic

Physical Demands/Work Environment :
Must be able to work in a seated position for extended periods
Must be able to use fingers, hands, and arms at computer keyboard for extended periods
Must have ability to speak clearly and distinctly, hear and be heard and understood both in person and by telephone
Must have ability to speak clearly and distinctly and hear and be heard and understood in person, by telephone and email
Must be able to work an early, non-standard schedule and long hours when needed
Compensation:
The starting salary range for this position is between $69,680 - $87,100 per year, plus an annual bonus plan. Actual compensation will be determined by skills, experience, and relevant education or training.
Benefits:
Singer employees enjoy generous paid time off, low-cost health insurance, a 401(k) plan with a company match, life and AD&D insurance, long-term and short-term disability, Snap-On tools for our techs, and continuous opportunities for learning and advancement within the company.
Equal Employment Opportunity:
We are committed to building a team that includes individuals from different cultural backgrounds, ethnicities, genders, ages, sexual orientation, and physical abilities, reflecting the diversity of the communities where we work and live.

Title: Competitive Intelligence Analyst
Descriptions:
This role could be hybrid or remote based on proximity to an office location.
At Ameritas, our mission is Fulfilling Life. We do that in many ways, but especially by helping people invest in themselves by offering trusted financial products and advice. Because we believe everyone should be happy, healthy, and financially secure, we work hard to provide trusted financial products and valued guidance, including individual life and disability insurance, employee benefits, retirement planning, investments, and wealth management services.
The Competitive Intelligence Analyst is responsible for researching, collecting, analyzing, and presenting data about our competitors, markets and customers that will help our internal business partners make informed business decisions. This position develops tools and processes to provide analysis at a level appropriate to the intended audience.
What you do
Develop and implement new ideas, tools and processes which further enhances competitor tracking. Prepare reports and graphic illustrations of findings.
Effectively develop and communicate results of complex analysis to both technical and nontechnical audiences.
Develop and assist in the maintenance of research data bases to provide competitive intelligence data to the product development process on an ongoing basis.
Establish research methodology and design format to gather data from other companies.
Participate in product development meetings to develop awareness enabling proactive competitive intelligence.
Develop procedures and codes of conduct for research and analyses.
Lead customer and market segmentation analyses to identify potential market opportunities for division products.
Develop and present recommendations for marketing programs and distribution channel opportunities based on results of analyses.
Other duties as assigned.
What you bring
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience required.
2-4 years related experience required.
General knowledge of health markets including dental/vision/Medicare.
Strong analytical ability; displays a high proficiency to analyze and present data/information.
Thorough knowledge of Microsoft office products (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) required.
Experience developing thought leadership content.
What we offer
Our company motto is “Fulfilling Life” and we take that job seriously, with a heavy commitment to volunteering and community support, employee well-being, and providing quality products and services that help our customers create a brighter future.
Being a mutual-based organization, the return on our investment goes back into the company, to benefit our members/customers.
We're committed to professional development, opportunity, inclusion, and diversity. Team building and collaboration are also priorities.
A total rewards package with all the comprehensive health and welfare benefits you'd expect, including competitive pay and incentives, 401(k), flexible work schedules and time off to care for yourself and others.
Additional popular benefits, including tuition reimbursement, and student loan repayment, an incentivized well-being program, adoption assistance, paid time off for volunteering, training, and career development opportunities.
An Equal Opportunity Employer
Ameritas has a reputation as a company that cares, and because everyone should feel safe bringing their authentic, whole self to work, we're committed to an inclusive culture and diverse workplace, enriched by our individual differences. We are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that hires based on qualifications, positive attitude, and exemplary work ethic, regardless of sex, race, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by law. Salary Range: $72,633-$114,684

Title: Business Analyst
Descriptions:
Hybrid - Candidate must be able to work ON-SITE at least 3 days/week and interview ON-SITE
The Virginia State Police (VSP) is procuring a SaaS solution for criminal and civil fingerprint capture and processing. Fingerprints are used to uniquely identify persons arrested and convicted of crimes. Fingerprints are also used for job applicant background checks to determine if the applicant has been arrested or convicted of a crime. VSP is looking for a Senior Business Systems Analyst to assist with the selection of a Software As A Service (SaaS) supplier and to help VSP and the supplier to implement a statewide SaaS livescan solution.
Duties include the following:
- Assist VSP to evaluate solution proposals submitted by industry leaders.
- Work with VSP and the supplier to improve livescan processes.
- Coordinate work with the VSP and supplier project managers.
- Partner with the livescan product owners to work with the supplier on a daily basis.
- Lead research and analysis related to requirements development and refinement.
- Coordinate the development of interfaces with VSP interface partners.
- Coordinate system testing, training and implementation.
- Coordinate livescan client installations.
To perform the duties above, the Senior Business Systems Analyst will:
- Lead the review, analysis and evaluation of current business systems, processes and helps VSP to identify opportunities for improvement.
- Elicit requirements using various elicitation techniques such as brainstorming, data mining, document analysis and interviews with users.
- Produce requirement artifacts such as field definition matrix, business rules, interface requirements and activity diagrams.
- Perform gap analyses to assess the ability of the supplier’s solution to meet VSP requirements and business needs.
- Contribute to and drive a collaborative effort to support organizational change management.
- Identify, document and help VSP manage project risks.
- Develop a requirements traceability matrix, business rules, interface requirements, test cases, activity diagrams, exception based error validations, user role based system profiles, security accesses and user profile management.
- Work collaboratively with various groups within the IT department, business units and prospective vendors to ensure functional requirement definitions are vetted and documented.
- Re-engineer and clearly define business processes for the new application.
- Identify how the new application and business processes will integrate with or replace existing business processes.
- Participate in the creation and subsequent reviews of project test plans with team members and business owners.
- Lead all final user acceptance efforts with business stakeholders.
- Define roles and access rights needed for the new application.
- Represent VSP's interests with prospective vendors and collaborate with them in order to meet the needs of the project and VSP’s business representatives.
- Provide training in the new solution.
Job Types: Full-time, Contract
Pay: $50.00 - $60.00 per hour
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Experience:
Functional/nonfunctional system requirements: 10 years (Preferred)
Work Location: Hybrid remote in Petersburg, VA 23803

Title: Data Modeler/Data Analyst
Descriptions:
Title: Data Modeler
Location: Dallas, TX
Mode Of Hiring: FTE
Job Description:
We want someone who has experience with modern customer (system of record) data modelling. Ideally this experience should be with industry standard data models in a financial services context and cover the main areas of:
Customer Identity – the core identity data elements
Communication Methods – phone, email, physical address
Relationships – between parties
Products and Services – their relationship with the bank’s accounts/services etc.
Preferences – consent, regulatory, privacy, language, solicitation
Demographics – employment, education, income, segmentation
Lifecycle Management – e.g. applicant, prospect, customer, historical customer
But the initial focus areas will be around the high-level customer data model entities i.e. like an MDM solution might have to deal with e.g. the party entity v’s the roles that party plays; with the focus on Customer Identity and Communication Methods since those are the criteria used for match/merge/search. It is important that they have experience building a cloud native database; ideally document based (since we already have people with relational db skills): the challenge isn’t just in modelling how the data is persisted in the database; but also how it is represented in the APIs and events.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $90.00 - $100.00 per year
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Ability to commute/relocate:

Title: BI Business Analyst
Descriptions:
About Carrot:
Carrot Fertility is the leading global fertility care platform for women, who are often at the center of fertility care decisions and consequences. Plus, Carrot serves people of every age, race, income, sex, sexual orientation, gender, marital status, and geography. Trusted by hundreds of multinational employers, health plans, and health systems, Carrot's comprehensive clinical program delivers industry-leading cost savings for employers and award-winning experiences for millions of people worldwide. Whether there is a need for care through fertility preservation, male-factor infertility, pre-pregnancy, IVF, pregnancy and postpartum, adoption, gestational surrogacy, or menopause, Carrot supports members and their families through many of the most memorable and meaningful moments of their lives.
The Role:
Carrot Fertility is looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) Business Analyst to support our team of data/business intelligence analysts, data scientists, and data engineers to improve processes, support requirements gathering, and documentation, working agilely straddling the line between the technical and the business to help bridge the gap and improve efficiency. You will collaborate cross-functionally with our internal customers, key stakeholders, and points of contact to elevate the customer and team member experience. You will support the Senior Director of Analytics and Business Intelligence to coordinate data projects, develop clear communication and documentation, build user guides, training manuals, and release notes.
We are looking for a highly motivated, process-driven individual with an agile mentality, someone who has proven time management and organizational skills that can synthesize sophisticated details and requirements into easily consumed concepts and vice versa. This individual should have the ability to build credibility and trust with diverse partners across all layers of the organization
The Team:
This individual will be a core team member contributing to the efficiency and process enhancements of all analytics and business intelligence products/projects. The role reports directly to the Senior Director of Analytics and Business Intelligence and supports a talented team of data/business intelligence analysts, data scientists, and data engineers.
Minimum Qualifications:
Hands on experience in a fast paced, project and development environment
Excellent requirements analysis, story writing, story validation, and stakeholder collaboration skills
Ability to assist in the creation and ongoing management of product/project backlog
Solid working experience utilizing agile tools such as Jira and Confluence
Experience working with version control systems (Git preferred)
Background in data with strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience and familiarity with current tech stack, including but not limited to SQL, DOMO, Python, Snowflake, dbt, Prefect, etc.
Experience with Healthcare data, even more ideal if specifically Fertility sector
In-depth knowledge and implementation of agile methodologies and best practices
Compensation:
Carrot offers a holistic Total Rewards package designed to support our employees in all aspects of their life inside and outside of work, including health and wellness benefits, retirement savings plans, short- and long-term incentives, parental leave, family-forming assistance, and a competitive compensation package. The expected base salary for this position will range from $90,000 - $123,000. Actual compensation may vary from posted base salary depending on your confirmed job-related skills and experience.
Why Carrot?
Carrot has received national and international recognition for its pioneering work, including Best Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion Product from the Anthem Awards, Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies, CNBC's 100 Barrier Breaking Startups, and more. Carrot is regularly featured in media reporting on issues related to the future of work, women in leadership, healthcare innovation and diversity, equity, and inclusion, including MSNBC, The Economist, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, CNBC, National Public Radio, Harvard Business Review, and more.
Carrot is fully distributed, with teams in more than 40 states across the United States and dozens of countries around the world. It has received numerous workplace awards, including Fortune's Best Workplaces in Healthcare, Quartz's Best Companies for Remote Workers, and Great Place to Work and Age-Friendly Employer certifications. Learn more at carrotfertility.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Descriptions:
This role is primarily responsible for the collection, analysis, and monitoring of metrics for the Program Management Office as it relates to new product development (NPD) milestones and KPIs, as well as the overall resource management profiling and reporting of plans and actuals and scenario planning. This role is responsible for the ongoing coordination and documentation for new product development meetings, audits, documentation, PMO website improvements, and maintaining alignment with the new product development process. This role will be responsible for identifying process improvements and driving efficiencies within new product development that provide time savings, communication, and better decision-making.
The Portfolio Data Analyst will help look for continuous improvement in the resource management tools and practices and will help functional and project managers with planning and allocating resources for projects and functional teams. They will help to determine an organization's demand for resources and ensure its capacity to meet staffing needs of projects is reported accurately as needed. They will implement and utilize web tools such as dashboards to reflect project and portfolio progress.
Job Responsibilities:
Act as lead and subject matter expert for metrics tracking and reporting including but not limited to resource management tools and methodologies across Engineering programs.
Act as lead PMO contact for resourcing metrics analysis, generation, and dissemination; Generate reports and interpret data from various platforms, such as Excel, PowerBI, Workday, etc., to help drive informed decision-making across the business.
Create and maintain portfolio documentation; Create and maintain program and portfolio dashboards and supporting data.
Own resource management tracking, forecasting and analysis for Engineering; Analyze resource data and profiles and future projection, capacity constraints and opportunities.
Identify ongoing resource changes within Engineering programs and update resource allocation and reporting to ensure accuracy.
Drive continuous improvement efforts around resource management practices and processes and identify opportunities and provide recommendations to streamline tools and reporting structure.
Own timesheet management process and execution across Engineering organization to ensure on-time submission, providing follow-ups and escalations as needed.
Own monthly resource reporting; identify and resolve data errors; lead the review to assess resource availability and follow up scenario planning
Prepare reporting for Illinois R&D tax credit reporting/audit, corporate R&D activity, ad-hoc data reports for usage and/or forecasts; produce quarterly budget reports based on hours used and forecasted; work with finance for proper Engineering expense allocation to profit centers
Own NPD review presentations, including updates and tollgates; Drive functional leaders and Program Managers to adhere to schedule, format, and process in support of the monthly NPD reviews
Lead and prepare portfolio summary presentation; Solicit input and compile individual program presentations, ensuring consistency between all inputs; Enforce submission deadlines and audit presentations for compliance with templates
Train team and act as a resource for questions regarding PDWare and the NPD Process
Support the development of planning templates to facilitate development and updating of core competencies; Audit standardized skills and ensure mapping back to engineering job descriptions
Lead compliance efforts within PMO and support of all ISO audits
Conduct tollgate audits to ensure deliverables are complete and accessible on SharePoint; Conduct internal audits to ensure readiness for ISO audits; Conduct 5-star PM best practice audits
Comply with health and safety guidelines and rules; managers should also ensure compliance across their teams
Protect the company’s reputation by keeping information confidential
Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reading professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies
Contribute to the team effort by accomplishing related results and participating on projects as needed
Job Requirements:
Bachelor's degree
Lean six sigma yellow belt or ability to become certified within 12 months of hire
3+ years of experience coordinating projects in support of strategic objectives, either independently or working with program managers or functional leaders
3+ years of experience with resource forecasting, tracking, and reporting
Experience analyzing, aggregating, and presenting data from multiple sources
Deep knowledge of and experience with stage-gate new product development processes
Experience with agile development processes
Experience preparing and organizing project, program, and portfolio review meetings
Experience in the setup, maintenance, and continuous improvement of knowledge/data sharing sites
Experience or ability to train groups of 20 or more with tools, processes, or work instructions
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:
Trained and practiced in professional project management
Advanced knowledge of MS Project
Advanced knowledge of Excel
Ability to work independently and influence the organization to comply with process improvements
Strong attention to details with an emphasis on organization and prioritization skills is required
Must be team-oriented and have outstanding verbal and written communication skills, including grammar and proofreading
Basic skills in finance, cross-cultural awareness, leadership, influence, negotiation, and conflict resolution
10% or more travel may be required
Preferred Job Requirements:
MBA or other advanced degree
PMP Certification
Experience with iTeam and PDWare
Experience with SharePoint, Confluence and Jira desirable
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $60,000.00 - $95,000.00 per year
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Monday to Friday
Weekend availability
Ability to commute/relocate:
Chicago, IL: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)
Experience:
Data analytics: 5 years (Preferred)
License/Certification:
Lean Six Sigma Yellow Belt (Required)
Work Location: In person

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Descriptions:
Our Mission
At Big Health, our mission is to help millions back to good mental health by providing fully digital, non-drug options for the most common mental health conditions. Our digital therapeutics — Daylight for anxiety, and Sleepio for insomnia — are available anytime and anywhere to help people overcome their mental health issues.

In pursuit of our mission, we’ve pioneered the first at-scale digital therapeutic business model, in partnership with some of the most prominent global healthcare organizations, including CVS Health and the UK’s NHS. Through product innovation, robust clinical evaluation, and a commitment to equity at scale, we are designing the next generation of medicine and the future of mental health care.

Big Health is a remote-first company, and this role can be based anywhere in the US. We encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet 100% of the job requirements.

As a Senior Data Engineer at Big Health, you will add a tremendous amount of value for our end-users by unlocking our ability to leverage data, enabling and contributing to our data driven decision making and helping refine our digital therapeutics for maximum effectiveness. Your work will help millions get back to good mental health. You will grow our domain-driven data mesh, leading a cross-functional working group that builds products and resources for our data consumers throughout the company. You will improve our internal data platform with new self-serve features, expanded trends monitoring and curated data sets. You will influence our data ecosystem end-to-end, from the data sources (Big Health’s applications and 3rd party services), through our internal pipelines and databases, to our reporting dashboards and machine learning services.
Essential Job Duties:
Grow our data mesh by inventing data products together with domain experts and stakeholders
Build self-serve data platform features that enable data creators and data consumers
Expand our data testing and data monitoring capabilities and coverage
Implement both near-real time and recurring batch data pipelines
Contribute to new data products such as curated data sets and machine learning services
Design software that is tested, scalable, extendable and performant
Suggest refinements our project goals that will better serve stakeholder needs
Lead the implementation plan for your workstreams
Propose technical solutions and process improvements that increase our team’s efficiency
Required Skills and Experience:
5+ years of experience in writing cloud-based software
Expertise with AWS data processing products (Kinesis, S3, Lambda, etc.) or comparable (Redis, Kafka, Google DataFlow, etc.)
Strong knowledge of relational DBs (Postgres, Snowflake, etc.) including SQL, data modeling, query tuning, etc.
Experience delivering software products built using Python
Experience using professional software development practices, including: Agile processes, CI/CD, etc)
Familiarity with distributed data processing frameworks (AWS Glue, Spark, Apache Beam, etc.)
Familiarity with modern data analysis, dashboarding and machine learning tools (DBT, Fivetran, Looker, SageMaker, etc.)
Life at Big Health:
Be part of a team that includes clinical psychologists, software engineers, business leaders and even a former professional magician [shh… it’s a secret]
Surround yourself with the smartest, most enthusiastic and dedicated people you’ll ever meet, but who listen well, learn from their mistakes and when things go wrong, generously pull together to help each other out
Check out our values - they’re a living, breathing part of our culture
Enjoy benefits including a generous vacation policy, professional development fund, flexible working locations and more.
Competitive salary packages including stock options
Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Additional compensation may include benefits, variable pay, discretionary bonuses and equity.

Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. The pay scale is subject to change depending on business needs.
Because we are on a mission to bring millions back to good mental health, we believe it’s essential to reflect the diversity of those we intend to serve. We’re an equal opportunity employer dedicated to building a culturally and experientially diverse team that leads with empathy and respect.

Additionally, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. Big Health participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with Form I-9 information from all new employees to confirm that they are authorized to work in the U.S. Big Health does not use E-Verify to pre-screen applicants.

Title: Data Analyst
Descriptions:
Sasaki Strategies, an in-house team of designers, analysts, and software developers, is looking for a new analyst to help us incorporate data into our design and planning work. Sasaki is one of the leading multi-disciplinary design firms in the world, with over 350 employees based primarily in the Boston region and over 700 awards for excellence in our architecture, site, and planning and urban design practices. Our team is a collaborative, cross-disciplinary group. This role will play a critical link between our design and planning services and the increasing use of complex data to inform decisions. The ideal candidate will demonstrate a strong understanding of data cleaning and analysis combined with a passion for finding the “so what” within a dataset that can drive decision-making. Although the preferred location is Boston, MA, we are open to candidates from the Denver & New York offices as well.
We are looking for someone who has an interest in solving problems that benefit people and the environment, is committed to our team’s success, and is excited to learn something new on a regular basis. It is important that you believe in creating equitable and inclusive outcomes both in the workplace and in the work you do.
What is the role and key activities?
Supporting data visualization efforts through data processing and analysis
Working with project teams to analyze data, interpret and prepare graphics and other materials to communicate key findings and strategies
Supporting Strategies product development through prototyping and research on emerging datasets and opportunities for new tools, workflows, or another initiative
Requirements
3-5 years’ experience in a data-focused role, preferably related to geospatial or built environment topics
Strong track record of implementing data processing techniques to clean, parse, and store datasets in both flat and database formats
Demonstrated expertise working with Microsoft Excel, Tableau and other tools for data manipulation
Ability to develop consistent, repeatable workflows for processing common data tasks
A collaborative approach to problem-solving and task completion
Experience with using statistical techniques for drawing insights: descriptive statistics, regression analysis, etc.
Additional Desired Skills
Experience with machine learning and other advanced techniques for analyzing and generating data
Experience working with geospatial datasets and programs, including census data and ArcGIS
Basic exposure to code and scripting: python, JavaScript, R and services like AWS
Knowledge of one of our disciplines (planning, architecture, etc.) is ideal but optional

Learn more about Sasaki Strategies at https://www.sasaki.com/practice/expertise/data-design-tools/

Title: Data Scientist - Fully remote
Descriptions:
Role Summary:
The Data Scientist will help Meduit develop tools that provide value to our customers by anticipating problems, forecasting, and predicting optimal action for resolution, and implementing machine learning prescriptive solutions. The primary focus of this role will be in applying data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis, and building high quality prediction systems integrated with our products. The Data Scientist will be responsible for intricately running analytical experiments in a methodical manner and will regularly evaluate alternative models via theoretical approaches.

Key Accountabilities:
Design and build validation tests to assess the efficiency of the model (or algorithm) in place and provide strategic insights to stakeholders.
Develop mechanisms to objectively measure the performance of initiatives against the proper benchmarks and propose recommendations for improvement. Create reporting to measure success and fails.
Develop frameworks, models, tools, and processes to ensure data influences decisions at all levels in a timely and high-quality manner.
Initiate and carry out analytic experiments aligned with long-term, strategic initiatives.
Combine great data analytics skills with strong business acumen to provide insights that will drive continued success.
Interact regularly with other data professionals both within and external to the company to develop new opportunities for applying machine learning approaches to Meduit’s domain of expertise.
Participate in agile or similar fast-paced development cycles
Competencies:
Communication: Creates an atmosphere in which timely and high-quality information flows smoothly with the business and development teams. Able to communicate with different levels of employees. Explain complicated items in simple ways.
Decision Making: Makes decisions authoritatively and wisely, after adequately contemplating various available courses of action. Willing to fail quickly and move on from ideas that are not productive.
Initiative: Does more than is required or expected in the job; does things that no one has requested that will improve or enhance products and services, avoid problems, or develop entrepreneurial opportunities.
Client Service: Demonstrates strong commitment to meeting the needs of both internal and external customers striving to ensure their full satisfaction.
Organization: Establishes a systematic course of action for self or others to ensure accomplishment of a specific objective. Sets priorities with an appropriate sense of what is most important and plans with an appropriate and realistic sense of the time demand involved.
Success Measures:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions
Qualifications:
BS/BA or Master’s Degree in an Applied Science OR 4 + years of relevant experience, preferably in a high-tech environment
Practical statistical programming language experience with SQL and Python.
Strong background in statistics, modeling and optimization as demonstrated by either industry experience or coursework/academic research.
Outstanding attention to detail and ability to deliver timely and accurate products in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. Ability to change gears.
Special Position Requirements:
Language Skills: Ability to write reports, business correspondence, and technical documentation. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, and customers.
Mathematical Skills: Ability to understand advanced statistical concepts required for predictive analytics. Understanding of probabilities and game theory.
Reasoning Ability: Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form. Outside of the box thinking.
Computer Skills: To perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of machine learning programming. Python and SQL are musts.
Other Skills: High energy level, great interpersonal skills needed for this position. Strong work ethic with a passion for success. Having the ability to work multiple items/projects. Logical thought process.
Work Requirements:

Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel and talk or hear. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.

Work Environment The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Title: Data Analyst
Descriptions:
Since 2006, CoStrategix has defined and implemented digital transformation initiatives, data & analytics capabilities, and digital commerce to Fortune 500 and mid market customers. CoStrategix brings thought leadership, strategy, and full end-to-end technology execution for organizations to transform and stay competitive in today’s digital world.

As a Gixer (employee) at CoStrategix, you will have broad exposure to diverse industries and technologies. You will work on leading-edge digital projects in areas of Data Lakes, Data Warehouses, Data Analysis, Data Insights and Activation, Business Intelligence, Data Governance, and Metadata in an Agile process setting. CoStrategix operates at the leading edge of technologies.

This role offers hybrid remote flexibility, based out of our culture hub located in Blue Ash, Ohio.

About this role:
The Data Analyst is a critical member of a team focused on the design, development, implementation, and maintenance of analytics databases. This position will be responsible for creating data models and SQL queries, and designing processes for data ingestion, data transformation, and data activation through BI and insights. The successful Data Analyst will stay current in the data domain and is eager to learn new technologies. They will look for opportunities to apply this learning to reduce delivery time, costs and/or deliver new insights or capabilities within a project(s).

In this role you will:
Consult with clients on their business needs and the data needed to fulfill those business needs.
Translate client data needs into requirements for data models, data transformations, and data queries.
Perform research & analysis into the domain of the work specific to a given client or dataset.
Create data models, SQL scripts, and transformations, and validations needed to support the data warehouses.
Analyze data sources for their accessibility and applicability to business problems.
Incorporate performance improvements and industry best practices into SQL and data scripts.
Validate data and the results obtained from queries or reports.
Consult with clients in both business and technology dimensions and translate between them as needed.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Analyze, understand, and contribute to systems architecture and programming constructs such as APIs, data models, and ER diagrams.
Communicate daily with other analysts, developers, project managers and Team leads on work status.
Work with technical architects and developers to research and assess various technologies that can be used together to solve a business problem.
Work with clients/testers to ensure the product meets the client requirements - in phases of data validation, user acceptance testing, etc
Work with geographically cross-located teams.
Exhibit strong competency in data mapping and SQL.

Qualifications:
Bachelor Degree in Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field
3+ years experience in data or business analysis
2+ years of experience with SQL
Strong competencies in Excel, Jupyter, Python, R or other similar analysis tools/languages
Working knowledge of relational databases
Understanding of Data Warehouse architecture
Experience with ETL concepts and ETL tools
Experience with Business Intelligence / Visualization tools

We make CoStrategix an awesome place to work with a total rewards package that includes comprehensive benefits starting day 1. Benefits include: medical, dental, vision, disability & life insurances, EAP and 401(k) retirement. We are a flexible hybrid workplace committed to a culture of curiosity, collaboration, learning, self-improvement and last, but not least, fun. We have been named a finalist for the Cincinnati Business Couier's Best Places to Work Awards for 4 consecutive years.

Do the Right Thing. Always.
At CoStrategix, we are passionate about our core values. Diversity, equity & inclusion (DE&I) are part of our core values Every Gixer (employee) has an opportunity for success regardless of their race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. Creating an environment where everyone, from any background, can do their best work is the right thing to do.

However, our organization is based on customer focus and recognizes the need for flexibility in serving customer groups with diverse interests.

Title: Data Analyst

Descriptions:
Wiliot was founded by the team that invented one of the technologies at the heart of 5G. Their next vision was to develop an IoT sticker, a computing element that can power itself by harvesting radio frequency energy, bringing connectivity and intelligence to everyday products and packaging, things previously disconnect from the IoT. This revolutionary mixture of cloud and semiconductor technology is being used by some of the world’s largest consumer, retail, food and pharmaceutical companies to change the way we make, distribute, sell, use and recycle products.
Our investors include Softbank, Amazon, Alibaba, Verizon, NTT DoCoMo, Qualcomm and PepsiCo.
We are growing fast and need people that want to be part of the journey, commercializing Sensing as a Service and enabling “Intelligence for Everyday Thing”.
This role offers a unique opportunity to engage in tactical data exploration and to build out solutions on top of the insights you identify. You will sift through massive amounts of data to discover “Ah ha!” moments for key customers that connect the dots between our technology and their key problems. You will then work with internal teams, and key customer teams to turn these insights into integrated solutions. Creativity, curiosity, and resilience are key for this role as you often won’t know what we’re looking for until we’ve found it.

2-5 years of relevant professional experience

Strong analytical and quantitative problem-solving abilities
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Ability to be self-sufficient and execute quickly when given autonomy
Experience with IoT data streams and business context a plus
Flexible team player who will thrive in a dynamic, constantly evolving environment
#LI-Hybrid

Participate in customer meetings and carefully listen for pain points and business problems

Hunt to uncover new insights in data generated by customer deployments
Build and deliver technical presentations to customers
Communicate effectively with engineers from many disciplines (including algorithm, software, and hardware engineers)
Work with internal product teams and customer teams to turn insights into integrated solutions.

Descriptions:
Since its inception, The Parking Spot has made superior airport parking experiences easy and affordable by focusing on hospitality. Now with more than 20 years in business, The Parking Spot has cemented itself as the leading near-airport Parking Company with 38 locations at 21 airports, and over 1,500 employees nationwide.
What makes working at The Parking Spot so special? We have created a culture of support, fun, and camaraderie that allows us to be the most innovative company in the parking industry. As a nationwide business with a small business feel, there are endless opportunities within The Parking Spot to grow your career. Come join us and see how we leverage people and technology to deliver a superior product, outshine our competition, and find creative and innovative solutions to everyday problems.

Hybrid work environment with a flexible schedule
Career development and growth opportunities
Ability to gain exposure to all areas of the business
Great benefits including Medical, Vision, Dental and a 401k plan
Team oriented, fun and friendly work environment
Immediate opportunity to make a large impact
Position Summary:
The Data Analyst will be a key contributor on our Revenue Strategy and Analytics team, collaborating with a variety of functional departments across the company to drive our core business goals and decision-making. We operate in a dynamic, high-volume business environment with millions of transactions, reservations, and loyalty members. As a Data Analyst at The Parking Spot, you will have the opportunity to make a significant impact on the business through your customer-oriented segmentation and attribution efforts. This position is perfect for a candidate with a passion for data, a creative analytical mind, and a strong technical foundation.
Our offices are based in the heart of the Loop in downtown Chicago, but we are pleased to note that our Chicago office is operating on a hybrid work model (mix of in-office and remote work).
Key Responsibilities:
Assess our business processes and how they support our company goals
Collaborate with different functional areas on major technical and analytical projects
Design and develop new data pipelines to automate generation of analyses
Perform exploratory analyses using relevant business questions, particularly related to client and consumer behavior
Present and communicate results of analyses to the management team and stakeholders

4-year BA/BS college degree
2+ years of professional business and/or data analysis experience
Proficiency using SQL to create, transform, and access data

Proficiency in Microsoft Office products, especially Excel and PowerPoint
Familiarity with Python and data-related packages is a plus

Strong sense of curiosity, urgency, and excitement around challenging business questions
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts and findings to diverse audiences

Title: Data Scientist
Descriptions:
Who is Flock?
Flock Safety provides the first public safety operating system that empowers private communities and law enforcement to work together to eliminate crime. We are committed to protecting human privacy and mitigating bias in policing with the development of best-in-class technology rooted in ethical design, which unites civilians and public servants in pursuit of a safer, more equitable society.
Our Safety-as-a-Service approach includes affordable devices powered by LTE and solar that can be installed anywhere. Our technology detects and captures objective details, decodes evidence in real-time, and delivers investigative leads into the hands of those who matter.
While safety is a serious business, we are a supportive team that is optimizing the remote experience to create strong and fun relationships even when we are physically apart. Our flock of hard-working employees thrive in a positive and inclusive environment, where a bias towards action is rewarded. Flock Safety is headquartered in Atlanta and operates nationwide. We have raised over $380M in venture capital including a recent Series E round led by Tiger Global. Now surpassing a 3B valuation, Flock is scaling intentionally and seeking the best and brightest to help us meet our goal of reducing crime in the United States by 25% in the next three years.
Additional Information
How To Succeed at Flock Video
Flock's Series E Announcement
How We Stop Crime and Protect Privacy
Flock's Framework
Ethics Center
The Role
Flock is looking for a passionate Ops Data Scientist to explore, mine, and build data, and leverage it using advanced analytical techniques to help drive critical business decisions.
How you'll make an impact:
Perform analyses on large datasets using statistical and AI techniques to derive insights
Design and build seamless decision support tools that leverage advanced analytical techniques
Understand and augment key data sources to be leveraged in decision making
Work with teams from across the business to execute on data and analytics needs to help them better understand tactical and strategic opportunities
We're looking for people who have:
BS/MS in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or related field, or equivalent industry experience
3+ years proven experience as a data scientist, ML engineer, or BI engineer
Strong experience using Python and its core AI/ML/OR packages
Strong SQL and data processing skills
Experience modeling data to drive analytics
Experience in Tableau
Ability to communicate and drive for solutions to complex and abstract problems
Effectively communicate, and seek to understand and be understood
Feeling uneasy that you haven't ticked every box? That's okay; we've felt that way too. Studies have shown women and minorities are less likely to apply unless they meet all qualifications. We encourage you to break the status quo and apply to roles that would make you excited to come to work every day.
Our Values
Our values define how we approach our work every single day:
Do the Work
Optimism With a Plan
Embrace Change to Grow
Protect the Whole Community
To read more about our values click here.
Why Join Us?
While being surrounded by a bunch of cool people working to eliminate crime is its own reward, we have plenty more to offer:
We have raised over $380M in venture capital and are backed by some of the top VCs including a16z, Tiger Global, Meritech and more
91% of our employees recommend working here
We have an audacious goal of reducing crime in the United States by 25% over the next three years
3% of crimes in the US are solved by Flock, and we help to solve ~200 crimes a day
We partner with 2100+ cities and 1500+ agencies across the US and process 1.1B+ images a week (we process more images than Instagram )
The Perks
Salary & Equity: In this role, you'll receive a starting salary of $155,000-$175,000 as well as stock options
Use what you need PTO: We seriously mean it, plus 11 company holidays and your birthday off!
️Fully-paid health benefits plan for employees: including Medical, Dental, and Vision and an HSA match.
Family Leave: We provide 16 weeks of 100% paid leave for primary caregivers and 12 weeks of 100% paid leave for secondary caregivers.
Fertility & Family Benefits: We have partnered with Maven, a complete digital health benefit for starting and raising a family. We will reimburse $10,000 a year for adoption, surrogacy, or infertility.
Mental Health: All employees receive an annual subscription to Headspace
Caregiver Support: We have partnered with Cariloop to provide our employees with caregiver support
Carta Tax Advisor: Employees receive 1:1 sessions with Equity Tax Advisors who can address individual grants, model tax scenarios, and answer general questions.
WFH Stipend: $150 per month to cover the costs of working from home.
L&D Stipend: $250 per year to use on Audible, Calm, Masterclass, Duolingo, Grammarly and so much more.
Home Office Stipend: A one-time $750 to help you create your dream office.
Coworking Space: If you're not local to our ATL HQ, we'll provide $250 a month to get you set up with an All Access Membership to WeWork (or a local coworking space in your area).
Pet Insurance: We've partnered with Pumpkin to provide insurance for our employee's fur babies.

Flock is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diverse backgrounds and thoughts and welcome everyone to apply for employment with us. We are committed to fostering an environment that is inclusive, transparent, and collaborative. Mutual respect is central to how Flock operates, and we believe the best solutions come from diverse perspectives, experiences, and skills. We embrace our differences and know that we are stronger working together.
If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please email us at careers@flocksafety.com. This information will be treated as confidential and used only to determine an appropriate accommodation for the interview process.
