Title: Marketing Operations Analyst
Descriptions:
What We Do
With residents and partners, LISC forges resilient and inclusive communities of opportunity across America – great places to live, work, visit, do business and raise families.

Strategies We Pursue
Equip talent in underinvested communities with the skills and credentials to compete successfully for quality income and wealth opportunities.
Invest in businesses, housing and other community infrastructure to catalyze economic, health, safety and educational mobility for individuals and communities.
Strengthen existing alliances while building new collaborations to increase our impact on the progress of people and places.
Develop leadership and the capacity of partners to advance our work together
Drive local, regional, and national policy and system changes that foster broadly shared prosperity and well-being.
Over the last 40 years, LISC and its affiliates have invested approximately $24 billion in businesses, affordable housing, health, educational mobility, community and recreational facilities, public safety, employment and other projects that help to revitalize and stabilize underinvested communities. Headquartered in New York City, LISC’s reach spans the country from East coast to West coast in 38 markets with offices extending from Buffalo to San Francisco and in 2,400 rural counties across 49 states and Puerto Rico. Visit us at www.lisc.org

About Strategic Investments
The LISC Strategic Investments team leads the design, development, and deployment of impact investment funds in LISC’s local markets nationwide. Strategic Investments employs an “impact first” investment methodology that optimizes the impact on the communities we care about while achieving sustainable risk-adjusted returns for investors.
The unique power of LISCs local office presence combined with the strength of our national investment expertise is a powerful combination for creating real impact in the communities we serve. This network requires careful coordination between Strategic Investments, the LISC Local Offices, and other stakeholders within LISC. While many groups within the LISC organization support fund management activities, the Strategic Investments team is ultimately responsible for ensuring a successful track record for LISC’s off balance sheet fund investments. Visit us at www.liscstrategicinvestments.org

ABOUT THIS ROLE
The LISC Fund Management team has been organized into functional expertise groups that lead and support the activities necessary to design, raise, deploy, and manage Impact Funds. Those functional groups are listed below:
Fund Design & Modeling – initial fund concept design and modeling, market testing
Fund Development – raising money from investors for the fund
Fund Deployment – creating the investment origination strategy and managing the underwriting and investment process
Fund Performance & Measurement – managing the performance of existing investments and conduit funds, oversight of financial statements & impact reporting
In LISC Fund Management (LFM), we are charged with coordinating the development, investment in, and deployment of impact investment funds in LISC’s local markets nationwide. While many groups within the LISC organization support fund management activities, LFM will be ultimately responsible for ensuring a successful track record for LISC’s off balance sheet lending, coordinating the efforts of relevant teams to ensure the overall organization understands who is playing what role and executes on the overall strategy. This positions reports to the Senior Director of Marketing, and sits in the Marketing Team, which supports both LISC Fund Management and LISC Strategic Investments teams.
The following are an indication of the position’s core responsibilities; these are intended to illustrate the scope of responsibilities and are not exclusive of other duties that may be required.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
The following are an indication of the position’s core responsibilities; these are intended to illustrate the scope of responsibilities and are not exclusive of other duties that may be required.
Responsibilities:
Organize and track marketing materials, to include PR contact tracking and contact list creation, stakeholder permission tracking and asset collection, and marketing asset organization.
Create content for social media accounts
Maintain and update website content, collateral materials, PowerPoint decks
Plan and organize quarterly and annual events
Build and manage excel trackers for various projects and tasks
Assist in developing impact stories (written or video) of borrowers and projects
Assist Senior Director in developing and refining messaging and strategy for the team
Maintain marketing contact information in Salesforce or Smartsheet?
Track and prepare for conferences.
Bring new and innovative ideas for marketing strategies and technologies.
Perform all other duties as assigned.

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program with a concentration or major in communications, marketing, graphic design, web design, business, or similar degree from an accredited college or university.
An interest in impact investing or community development is preferred.
Experience in alternative investments (private equity or real estate), real estate, business lending, and/or affordable housing fields is preferred.
Have excellent oral and written communication skills.
Have excellent organizational skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, PPT, Excel), Wix, internet research, Canva, Hootsuite, social media platforms. Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop) experience preferred.
Ability to learn and navigate new knowledge areas and software.

LISC offers a competitive salary ($73,610 - $86,600; salary commensurate with experience and location )and excellent fringe benefits. This position is expected to travel less than once a month, up to 15% annually.

LISC is an equal opportunity employer. LISC does not discriminate in employment on account of actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), gender identity or expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military status or veteran status, unfavorable discharge from military service, physical or mental disability, protected medical condition as defined by applicable state or local law, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances.
We will endeavor to make a reasonable accommodation to the known physical or mental limitations of a qualified applicant with a disability unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business.
LISC IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER COMMITTED TO DIVERSITY, EQUITY, INCLUSION AND JUSTICE

Title: Business Data Analyst (Remote)
Descriptions:
Company Overview
EPS School Specialty is a leading K-12 supplemental literacy and math curriculum company. Its suite of solutions include many well-known, trusted and proven products including SPIREⓇ, Explode the CodeⓇ and Success CoachⓇ. The company recently took on a private equity partner committed to product and go-to-market investments that will position the company for explosive growth over the coming years. We are looking for candidates who want to be part of addressing one of our nation’s most critical challenges. Fewer than a third of all students can read proficiently. Reading ability is a key driver of equity since only 20% of Hispanic students, and 16% of Black students can read proficiently by 4th grade. You will be joining a high-paced, creative and fun team dedicated to making a difference in children’s lives, and driving equity across our nation’s public schools.

Position Summary
We are searching for a solution-oriented Business Data Analyst who will be responsible for supports the information needs of multiple functional areas, including sales, marketing, and supply chain. The successful candidate will work closely with stakeholders to identify data sources and reporting requirements and help the company shape its long term reporting and analytics landscape. The ideal candidate should have a strong understanding of business processes, experience in data analysis and problem-solving, and possess excellent communication and collaboration skills.

Responsibilities
Identify and develop solutions for the information and analysis requirements of the business
Provide objective, reliable, and timely decision support analysis for management relating to customer behavior.
Develop and maintain sales dashboards and reports to track key performance metrics.
Support sales forecasting, pipeline management, and compensation reporting.
Provide ad-hoc reports and analysis as needed.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity within various systems.
Develop and maintain scheduled reporting, reporting applications, and advanced business models.
Explain report and analysis output to business leaders using written and verbal communication, including formatting information for presentations.

Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
2+ years of experience in business analysis or related field.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and techniques (e.g., SQL, Excel, VBA).
Advanced ability to use data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau).
Experience with Salesforce or other CRM systems.
Experience with Google Analytics or other web data systems.
Experience with IBM Cognos and Stratum a plus.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Detail-oriented with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.

Benefits and Perks
We offer a competitive compensation package based on various factors including but not limited to qualifications, skills, competencies, location, and experience.
Other rewards may include an annual bonus or commission, a 401(k) retirement plan with employer match, medical, dental, and vision insurance effective day 1, generous PTO and paid holidays, and employer paid life and short & long term disability insurance.
We provided you with a laptop for your home office and a flexible remote-first work culture.

Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. Our organization is dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply! You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. Please be sure to attach your resume. Applications without an attached resume will be considered incomplete. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Research Success
Descriptions:
Data Analyst, Research Success
Truveta was formed and governed by US health systems with a shared vision of saving lives with data. Truveta now offers the world's first health data and analytics solution to study patient care and outcomes. Our mission is to enable researchers to find cures faster, empower every clinician to be an expert, and help families make the most informed decisions about their care. Achieving Truveta' s ambitious mission requires an incredible team of talented and inspired people with a special combination of health, software and big data experience who share our company values.
Truveta was born in the Pacific Northwest, but we have employees who live across the country. Our team enjoys the flexibility of a hybrid model and working from anywhere. In person attendance is required for two weeks during the year for Truveta Planning Weeks.
For overall team productivity, we optimize meeting hours in the pacific time zone. We avoid scheduling recurring meetings that start after 3pm PT, however, ad hoc meetings occur between 8am-6pm Pacific time.
Who We Need
Truveta is rapidly building a talented and diverse team to tackle complex health and technical challenges. Beyond core capabilities, we are seeking problem solvers, passionate and collaborative teammates, and those willing to roll up their sleeves while making a difference. If you are interested in the opportunity to pursue purposeful work, join a mission-driven team, and build a rewarding career while having fun, Truveta may be the perfect fit for you.
The Opportunity
This Data Analyst will report to our Director of Research Success on the Partner team. They will focus on supporting strategic engagements with its Life Sciences partners. Leveraging technical skillsets, they will deliver collateral that will be used by members of the team to demonstrate the value of Truveta to prospective customers and drive adoption of the Truveta Studio in the Life Sciences space. The Analyst will have a strong background in health care, real world data (RWD), and leveraging programming skills to analyze Real World Data.
Responsibilities:
Use technical skills and domain expertise to receive incoming customer requests and produce custom analyses and results
Scope research project for what will be required, ask questions to clarify details, conduct custom analyses in R or Python on EHR data, produce result outputs (tables and plots)
Collaborate closely with other Truveta teams to conduct investigations of data sources to demonstrate veracity to current customers
Deliver feedback to internal teams based on customer requests to inform Truveta's product roadmap
Required Skills:
BS in Computer Science, Data Analysis, or equivalent
3+ years of experience analyzing Electronic Health Record data or other Real World Data sources in healthcare
Advanced skills using Python or R to conduct data analysis
Knowledge of electronic health record or claims data for data analysis
Preferred Qualifications
These qualifications are preferred but not required, please do not let them from stop you from applying for this role. You will likely get the opportunity to learn how to do these more advanced analyses if you don't already have experience.
Statistics
Regression
Kaplan-Meier Analyses
Survival Analyses
SQL experience
Why Truveta?
Be a part of building something special. Now is the perfect time to join Truveta. We have strong, established leadership with decades of success. We are well-funded. We are building a culture that prioritizes people and their passions across personal, professional and everything in between. Join us as we build an amazing company together.
We Offer:
Interesting and meaningful work for every career stage
Great benefits package
Comprehensive benefits with strong medical, dental and vision insurance plans
401K plan
Professional development & training opportunities for continuous learning
Work/life autonomy via flexible work hours and flexible paid time off
Generous parental leave
Regular team activities (virtual and in-person as soon as we are able)
The base pay for this position is $106,000 to $139,000. The pay range reflects the minimum and maximum target. Pay is based on several factors including location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Certain roles are eligible for additional compensation such as incentive pay and stock options.
If you are based in California, we encourage you to read this important information for California residents linked here.
Truveta is committed to creating a diverse, inclusive, and empowering workplace. We believe that having employees, interns, and contractors with diverse backgrounds enables Truveta to better meet our mission and serve patients and health communities around the world. We recognize that opportunities in technology historically excluded and continue to disproportionately exclude Black and Indigenous people, people of color, people from working class backgrounds, people with disabilities, and LGBTQIA+ people. We strongly encourage individuals with these identities to apply even if you don't meet all of the requirements.

Title: Applied Machine Learning Scientist
Descriptions:
Applied Machine Learning Scientist

About Grainger:
Grainger is North America's leading distributor of maintenance, repair, and operating products and services. Our wide assortment, deep expertise, innovative technology solutions and unparalleled customer service keep customers' operations running and their people safe.
We're looking for passionate people who can move our company forward. We have a welcoming workplace where you can build a career for yourself while fulfilling our purpose to keep the world working. We embrace new ways of thinking and recognize everyone is an individual. Find your way at Grainger.

Position Details:
We are looking for an Applied Machine Learning Scientist to join our team of 50+ other Analytics and Data team members who are passionate about applying data and quantitative methods to provide tangible, long-term monetary benefits to our organization. The Applied Machine Learning Scientist will report to a Manager of Data Science.
Our Machine Learning area spans across Recommender Systems, Optimization and Simulation, Natural Language Processing, and other Machine Learning / Deep Learning-based applications. The Applied Machine Learning Scientist is someone with programming experience, applied machine learning experience and engineering skills.

You Will:
Develop machine learning and deep learning models that improve the effectiveness of our business operations
Automate work across the organization to improve our speed and efficiency
Work with the business to understand the problem space, identify the opportunities, and translate our problems into technical solutions using machine learning frameworks
Research new techniques and technologies in the space of ML / AI, Intelligent automation, NLP and evaluate their potential for specific business use cases
Build machine learning pipelines from ideation, prototyping, development, and deployment
Apply techniques such as classification, clustering, regression, NLP, deep learning (CNN, RNN, GANs), time series forecasting, Bayesian methods to build scalable solutions
Manipulate high-volume, high-dimensionality data from multiple sources, visualize patterns, anomalies, relationships, and trends, and perform feature engineering and selection
Create scalable, efficient, automated processes for large-scale data analyses, model development, model validation and deployment
Create and deploy products, automate and integrate into systems and business processes; develop consumable endpoints (Web Applications, REST APIs)
Monitor deployed products for continuous improvement (hyperparameter tuning)

You Have:
Required Education/Experience:
2+ years of experience using python, pyspark, or Scala (outside coursework)
BA or MS in a technical field such as Mathematics, Data Science, Applied Analytics, Operations Research, Computer Science, Applied Science or Engineering
Proficient in usage of databases (e.g. Teradata, Snowflake, s3) and querying languages (e.g. SQL, Spark SQL)
Advanced programming skills with R, Python, and other Scripting languages
Experience working in containerization ecosystems (Kubernetes or Docker)
Advanced data science toolsets (e.g. tensorflow, pytorch, scikit learn)
Experience developing and employing model risk management strategies (model registry, concept/covariate drift monitoring, Hyperparameter tuning)
Experience deploying products using technologies like Spark and Airflow

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Descriptions:
Shaped is an API for ranking. We help developers create frictionless discovery experiences using feeds, recommendations and notifications. Ultimately, our goal is to make AI accessible for everyone and we see machine-learning for discovery (e.g. TikTok "For-You Page", FB “News feed” and YouTube "What to watch next") as the best place to start.
Shaped is a YC-backed seed-stage startup. The founders built many of the ranking models at Facebook and have also worked at Uber, Afterpay and Google. We're a team of 5 working remotely across the globe and are about to get an office in NYC.
We are looking for a machine learning engineer to design, build and optimize Shaped's ranking engine. You will be a founding engineer working on state-of-the-art machine-learning infrastructure. You will have the chance to touch all parts of the production and experimentation ML stack - from modeling to infrastructure. As one of Shaped’s early employees you will help shape our product roadmaps and engineering culture. We’re excited to work, collaborate, grow, teach, and learn from you.
This role is for a full-time engineer at $120k - $160k a year and 0.3% - 1.0% equity.
Responsibilities:
Experiment and develop predictive ranking models for customer's discovery use-cases.
Experiment and develop with pre-trained image, language, audio and video embedding models that understand our customer's discovery data.
Build the infrastructure to train and deploy Shaped's embedding and ranking models.
Implement data validation and logging infrastructure for monitoring our production models.
Optimize machine-learning libraries and accelerate models to serve real-time inference.
Work on our real-time and batch data ingestion pipelines using modern data engineering pipelines/streams.
Work closely with a small team to inform the roadmap and co-develop a strong engineering culture with best practices.
Requirements:
Bachelor's in computer science, data science or mathematics related field. Master's degree or PhD will be advantageous.
3+ years of machine learning engineering industry experience.
Proficient with Python, SQL.
Extensive knowledge of ML frameworks, modeling, and data engineering tools.
In-depth knowledge of mathematics, statistics and algorithms.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
We’re building the future of AI. Come join us!

Title: Quantitative Researcher / Quantitative Research Analyst
Descriptions:
Job Description
Role Summary
At Citadel Securities, a leading global market maker, our team of quantitative researchers models the markets and brings trading strategies to life every day. Specifically, this team develops and tests automated quant trading strategies using sophisticated statistical techniques. We’re looking for an extraordinary quantitative researcher who is committed to our core values that include winning, acting with integrity, continuously learning, and cultivating a meritocracy.
Depending on your background and expertise, opportunities are available in Miami, Chicago, New York, London, Dublin, Zurich, Hong Kong or Sydney
Objectives
Conduct research and statistical analyses in the evaluation of securities
Work with large data sets, including unconventional data sources, to predict and test statistical market patterns
Conceptualize valuation strategies, develop and continuously improve mathematical models, and translate algorithms into code
Back test and implement trading models and signals in a live trading environment
Skills and Preferred Qualifications
Advanced training in mathematics, statistics, physics, computer science, or another highly quantitative field
Proficiency in probability & statistics (e.g. time-series analysis, machine learning, pattern recognition, NLP)
Prior experience working in a data driven research environment
Hands on programming experience in scripting (e.g. Python), analytical packages (e.g. R, Matlab) and/or compiled languages (e.g. C++)
A background demonstrating strong analytical problem solving skills
An ability to communicate advanced concepts in a concise and logical way
Proficiency in creating and using algorithms to meticulously investigate and work through large data or error-checking problems
In accordance with New York City’s Pay Transparency Law, the base salary range for this role is $200,000 to $350,000. Base salary does not include other forms of compensation or benefits.
About Citadel Securities
Citadel Securities is the next-generation capital markets firm and a leading global market maker. We provide institutional and retail investors with the liquidity they need to trade a broad array of equity and fixed income products in any market condition. The brightest minds in finance, science and technology use powerful, advanced analytics to solve the market’s most critical challenges, turning big ideas into real-world outcomes.

Title: Machine Learning Data Engineer
Descriptions:
Overview:
The Machine Learning Data Engineer fulfills a foundational role in the modeling workflows and acts as a Data Engineer at AFCU focused on the AFCU machine learning environment. They will work with Machine Learning Engineers and Data Scientists to generate the needed features to support models within the given SLA's. The Data Engineer will work diligently to check the data quality of those pipelines and set appropriate thresholds to either alert or break a pipeline depending on data quality issues. The Data Engineer also needs to be proactive and identify future features groups that will allow models to utilize additional information about members or accounts to drive the correct decision. The Data Engineer will be the primary stakeholder of the Feature Store, and related technologies to migrate the data to and from it, and responsible for cross-training and maintaining contribution standards and workflows. We expect the Data Engineer to be the core contributor, but not the sole contributor, so workflows should be optimized so that Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers can self-serve as much as possible with a heavy focus of protecting the data
model and evolving it in a sustainable way.

We do not build for the sake of building or to pad resumes. Everything is focused on working with a business owner to get the best (balancing complexity and accuracy) model into production and executing, even if that is a decision tree and not a neural network. We put a heavy emphasis on
being able to deploy models into production quickly as a team which includes writing tests, setting up monitoring, and performing code reviews for those data pipelines.

Our culture can be summed up as:

We all love building machine learning/AI systems
We all have a life outside of work
We challenge each other
We prefer common tools and frameworks over niche tools and frameworks
We prefer open source over proprietary, but do value the buy versus build judgement call when it is something we need but do not want as a core competency
We value simplicity over complexity
Always leave the code base better than you found it

What we value most in a team member is someone who can look at a vaguely defined problem and work iteratively in a collaborative fashion to find a concrete clean solution.

In general, the cadence of the team follows agile rituals, however, we do not expect models or their supporting architecture to be completed within a sprint. Being a data focused team, we understand that we do not know the answers, and that modeling can take a lot of twists and turns. So, to aid in
planning and communication we utilize agile rituals but understand that modeling deliverables can be wildly different both in size and time to complete.
Responsibilities:
Communicate.

It all starts and ends with communicating with business stakeholders. The Data Engineer works in a support role as a partner
with Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers to capture more features and expose those for modeling at training and inference time.
A lot of these features come from talking with business stakeholders as the subject matter experts to see how they think and view problems,
as well as Data Scientists as they generate and enhance models. Often the Data Engineer will need to work in an iterative pattern with
stakeholders ambiguous requirements to create concrete requirements to build on top of. The Data Engineer will need to engage with senior
management to communicate progress or roadblocks for projects from time to time.

Build, Enhance, and Deploy Feature Pipelines.

The Data Engineer is responsible for building and maintaining the feature store pipelines.
Including creating sustainable patterns so that users of the feature store can develop and deploy their own features. This will involve
maintaining development pipelines and best practices around the adoption of new data and data sources.

Monitor Features.

The Data Engineer is responsible for monitoring features utilizing different data quality tooling and fixing issues if/when
they occur.

Educate.

One of the core functions of the Data Engineer will need to perform is cross training others in how to build, deploy, and monitor
features. This may involve other product teams and citizen data scientists as well as the core data science team at AFCU.

Document.

Being a financial institution, we have a significant amount of documentation required for each model to comply with auditors.
While auto doc tools get us 70% of the way, the last 30% requires a human touch. This last 30% brings in the context of the business, model
application, and outcome. The Data Engineer will work with the Data Scientists and Machine Learning Engineers to make sure that they have
adequate feature documentation for their models. The Data Engineer is also responsible for championing the data catalog integration into the
Data Science Feature Store and creating practices that result in rich documentation.

Innovate.

The data science team is structured in a centralized manner within the credit union, which gives us the ability to see across several
business functions. Part of the team's role is to look at projects from the different business functions and implement cross functional synergies between different projects.
Qualifications:
Required Master's of Science in a STEM field or a Bachelor's of Science degree in a STEM field with equivalent experience of 3+ years.
3+ years of programming experience, preferably with Python, SQL, and PySpark.
3+ years working in a data warehouse/feature store environment.
3+ years of creating and maintaining data models.
Demonstrated experience working with distributed and container systems.
Must have development experience with various data management technology; NoSQL; relational database; message broker; multidimensional database; and design architecture.
A strong understanding of the data lifecycle within machine learning operations.
A strong understanding of how to monitor data.
Demonstrated experience working within an SDLC environment including tools such as git, wikis, task management, and build agents.
Financial institution experience, or active participation in the US credit system as a consumer, is desired.

Title: Business Analyst
Descriptions:
Grow your career while helping others grow their retirement savings!
When you join the team at Retirement Clearinghouse, you'll be making a real difference for yourself and others!
Our mission is to dramatically improve the odds that millions of America's job-changing participants will preserve their retirement savings and enjoy a comfortable and timely retirement. We leverage innovative financial technology to simplify and streamline the process of consolidating retirement savings accounts within the defined contribution system.
Business Analyst Compensation:
Base Annual Salary Range: $100,000-$110,000, commensurate with skills and experience
Annual Bonus Potential: maximum 10% of annual base salary, prorated from date of hire and subject to terms and conditions
Business Analyst Position Summary:
As a Business Analyst, you will review, analyze and evaluate business operations and processes to isolate problem areas, develop solutions, and identify business needs and opportunities. Additionally, the Business Analyst will create system process specifications to be used to modify business systems and prepare documentation and manuals. The Business Analyst will interact with clients, developers, business stakeholders, system architects and various subject matter experts.
Business Analyst Responsibilities
Leads and participates with departmental teams and key stakeholders, gathering information to better understand their business processes and needs, to increase efficiency, productivity, and functionality through automation and process enhancements.
Functions as a liaison between users, business units and IT.
Documents system requirements, defines scope and objectives and creates system specifications that drive system development and implementation.
Designs new business functionality by analyzing requirements, constructing workflow charts and diagrams, studying system capabilities and writing specifications.
Maintains system protocols by writing and updating procedures.
Provides references for users by writing and maintaining user documentation and training users.
Serves as the ultimate facilitator between business and IT in truly understanding the business needs and plays a key role in the overall management and success of the effort through the project lifecycle.
Effectively communicates and works with team members and other departments
Influences stakeholders to support business projects.
Defines project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases, and elements.
Identifies areas where technology can lead to increased efficiency and productivity.
Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing professional publications, establishing personal networks, benchmarking state-of-the-art practices and participating in professional societies.
Performs other duties as may be assigned.
Business Analyst Perks & Benefits:
Remote and/or hybrid work opportunities*-see below for additional information
Bonus potential
Paid Time Off-up to 18 days per year for the first 4 years, plus up to 5 sick days per year, plus up to 3 Floating Holidays per year (actual days for first year of employment is based upon date of hire)
Paid holidays
Medical, dental, vision, short and long-term disability, life insurance benefits on day 1 of employment
401k plan with immediately 100% vested employer matching contributions
Professional growth and Career Advancement opportunities
The Business Analyst will be required to work onsite for the first few days of employment for equipment assignment and training. After initial training is completed the Business Analyst will be required to work two (2) days per month in the office and will be permitted to work from home the remainder of the time. The Business Analyst may be required periodically to work onsite to attend work-related meetings or training in addition to the required two (2) days per month.

Title: Digital Communications, Data Analyst
Descriptions:
Digital Communications, Data Analyst

This role has been designated as ‘Office’, which means you will primarily work from an HPE office.
Job Description:

Hewlett Packard Enterprise is the global edge-to-cloud company advancing the way people live and work. We help companies connect, protect, analyze, and act on their data and applications wherever they live, from edge to cloud, so they can turn insights into outcomes at the speed required to thrive in today’s complex world. Our culture thrives on finding new and better ways to accelerate what’s next. We know diverse backgrounds are valued and succeed here. We have the flexibility to manage our work and personal needs. We make bold moves, together, and are a force for good. If you are looking to stretch and grow your career our culture will embrace you. Open up opportunities with HPE.
HPE’s Global Communications team has more than 100 communicators across the globe that advocate our corporate strategy, culture, reputation, and innovations. We are storytellers, creatives, producers and journalists, and the heart of HPE’s news engine.
We’re evolving and continually optimizing our approach to data-driven communication, and this is a rare opportunity to help shape the course.
How you’ll make your mark:

The ideal candidate is digitally & analytically savvy, passionate about audience behavior with a keen ability to identify story angles and engagement opportunities. Success requires an innovative and performance-driven mindset – to test, learn and continually optimize. You will:
Deliver measurement and reporting across internal and external channels. Partnering closely with digital channel owners, you’ll help guide our measurement framework, collect and analyze data, and deliver performance reports and insights that inform optimization plans for channels, content and engagement.
Analyze conversation and media coverage for story and content opportunities. Using quantitative and qualitative inputs, you’ll unearth stories and identify owned content and engagement opportunities; that drive audience reach and enhance corporate reputation.
Implement a data automation model across platforms. You’ll help unify performance data into a central data warehouse and onboard Business Intelligence analytics software for analysis. This is an exciting role, and one that’s critical to our data evolution.
Support activation across digital channels. As a key member of an agile team, you’ll step in to support digital channel owners (e.g. HPE Newsroom), including during peak moments and events.
Collaborate cross-functionally on 360° communications programs. Armed with data and insights, you will be called upon to provide insights and expertise that help inform strategies and tactics across Corporate, Business, and Team Member Communication plans.
About You:
We are looking for someone who has:
Superior analytic mindset and problem-solving skills.
Experience with digital measurement, channels, & tools.
Hyper-collaborative nature, excelling in a high-performance, team-oriented culture.
Self-motivation, ambition, and the ability to drive plans.
Passion to test, learn and optimize; within an agile environment.
Ability to work through ambiguity.
Desire to learn in an ever-changing world, technology industry and practice of communication.

BA or BS in Communications, Business, Analytics or related field
3+ years of experience in data analytics, digital communications or related field
Agency experience a plus

Title: Data Analyst
Descriptions:
We are looking for a high-performing Data Analyst to join our analytics practice. As an analyst, you will play an integral part of the team and work directly with our clients to provide best-in-class analytics solutions and data-driven insights. This role requires analytical curiosity and strong SQL skills, but is not a DBA or ETL developer role.
Key Responsibilities:
Create meaningful business insights out of customer, transactional, and other behavioral data.
Conduct both short- and long-term custom analytics projects, design analysis plans, and prepare client deliverables.
Query large databases and other data sources using SQL programming languages.
Support BI reporting development and CRM targeting efforts.
Identify meaningful business insights out of queried data and prepare summary findings for both internal and external stakeholders.
Build relationships and communicate regularly with external clients.
Experience & Skills:
Excellent data analytic skills. Your analytical thinking is far more important than technical skills
Curiosity when analyzing data. Documented history of thinking outside the box and creating novel solutions.
Analytic agility. Ability to change analysis direction based on interim findings.
Evidence of experience working with multiple, large datasets/warehouses, and ability to integrate and extract from such datasets using relevant programs and coding.
Experience using SQL to analyze customer level data, such as POS/transactional or weblog clickstream data.
Aptitude for refining informal analytic, reporting or query requirements to help move beyond the simple ask and surface the underlying “why”.
Strong Excel skills. Experience and familiarity with a wide variety of Excel functions and features (well beyond pivot tables).
Desired Qualifications:
Excellent communication skills. Experience explaining technical findings to non-technical audiences.
Experience using programming languages such as R or Python to extract, manipulate, and analyze customer data is a strong plus.
Statistical analysis experience is a plus: regression modeling, decision trees, clustering, etc.
BS or MS in Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Applied Economics, Biostatistics or a field involving experimental design, probabilities and quantitative analysis.
1-3 years of relevant experience.
Must be authorized to legally work in the United States without restrictions or need for a work visa.
Why Work at Centriam?
Small analytics company focused on delivering excellence and value to our clients by providing high quality analytical and data-driven solutions.
Fun & collaborative culture; you will wear many hats and play an integral part in projects.
Exposure to a wide variety of data analytics, cloud, and open source technologies.
“Take what you need” vacation policy.
401k with generous match, vested immediately.
Free drinks, coffee, beer, and snacks.
Downtown Minneapolis office, connected to skyway.

Title: Research Scientist
Descriptions:
Research Scientist
Since 1979, Prosperity Now (formerly CFED) has been a persistent voice championing economic opportunity, innovating outside of and beyond existing systems to build power for all communities. We advance racial and ethnic economic justice by investing in bold new ideas, and we work deeply at both the grassroots and national level to impact the entire ecosystem. By setting goals for our economy and following through with targeted approaches based on need, we are equipped to drive forward and cement big structural solutions.
Summary:
Everyone has a role to play in uplifting the solutions that will help all families, neighbors, and communities build sustainable wealth. We are seeking an experienced Research Scientist to join the Applied Research Team at Prosperity Now. The Applied Research Team is responsible for the development, curation, and translation of the research related to wealth and financial health.
Specifically, the Research Scientist will work closely within our team to design and conduct research projects, analyze data, and communicate findings through reports, presentations, and other mediums. This position will also be responsible for applying for research specific grants and other funding opportunities and will require demonstrated experience writing research reports with advanced skills in data visualization and statistical modeling.
We are looking for someone with excellent communication and collaboration skills as well as a strong commitment to equity and social justice. If you have a passion for advancing economic opportunity for all and reducing wealth disparities, we encourage you to apply. This position can be based either in our Washington, D.C. office or remotely, with occasional travel to Washington DC.
Accountability: Director of Applied Research
Responsibilities:
Help design the research approach, selecting appropriate quantitative (or qualitative) tools of analysis
Assist with the organization, coordination, and management of research activities to advance Prosperity Now’s research agenda
Plan and independently execute major segments of research projects in consultation with the Director and other senior staff
Draft relevant research papers and reports for publication on the Prosperity Now website, conferences, and peer-reviewed journals
Support research and communications staff in preparing other research content for the Prosperity Now website, blog, and social media
Assist with the development of internal and public research, including data products, research reports and briefs, and other written materials and presenting these to internal and external audiences as needed
Conduct background research on a range of topics related to wealth and financial health and stability outcomes, including performing literature reviews, synthesizing qualitative and quantitative information, and scanning the policy and practice landscape
Synthesize research literature and stakeholder perspectives to help identify the most important open questions on which new evidence building is needed
Monitor economic data releases and track new research publications, working papers, and reports released by academic, think tank, and other research organizations
Help secure funding through research grants
Other duties as assigned
Qualifications:
Submission of a STATA dofile, preferably on a topic related to financial well-being, wealth-building, economic mobility, etc. See Application Notes below for further instruction
A master’s degree or Ph.D. in a field related to quantitative social science (e.g. economics, sociology, demography, etc.)
For Ph.D.: minimum of 2 years of research experience in an academic, policy, or government setting
For Masters: minimum of 8 years of research experience in an academic, policy, or government setting
Demonstrated interest in financial well-being and economic mobility, including but not limited to financial assets and income, homeownership and housing, entrepreneurship and employment, and education
Familiarity with sources of and solutions to systematic racial inequalities in economic opportunity
Experience using datasets measuring wealth and financial health (Census/ACS, SIPP, etc.)
Expertise with statistical analysis software is required, experience with STATA is preferred
Strong statistical skills in areas such as survey weighting, and implementing high-quality quasi-experimental research designs and rigorously testing/validating model assumptions
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau
Exceptional written communication skills
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
A track record of self-direction and an ability to work independently while handling multiple projects and responsibilities, as well as a collaborative approach with an emphasis on teamwork for results
Demonstrated commitment to promoting equity in public policy and/or prior exposure to policy related issues
Supervisory Responsibility: None
Work Environment: This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment.
Physical Demands:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. This job description is subject to change at any time.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to communicate and exchange information. The employee frequently is required to remain in a stationary position and constantly operate computer and other office productivity machinery.
Travel: Periodic travel may be required to conferences and/or in-person meetings.
FLSA Classification: Exempt
Salary Range: $91,200 - $136,800

Title: Data Science Analyst
Descriptions:
Let’s be unstoppable together!
Circana (formerly IRI and NPD) is the leading advisor on the complexity of consumer behavior. Through unparalleled technology, advanced analytics, cross-industry data and deep expertise, we provide clarity that helps almost 7,000 of the world’s leading brands and retailers take action and unlock business growth. We are a recognized leader in equality and have consistent year-over-year increases in client satisfaction and business growth. Circana also offers flexible time off and a hybrid work environment. Join our inclusive, committed team to be a challenger, own outcomes, and stay curious together. Learn more at
www.circana.com
.

Position Overview
Circana is looking for a resourceful professional to be a hands-on analyst on our classification and anomaly detection data science team. The role requires strong analytical skills and data processing skills. It requires someone who exhibits great attention to detail. This is a results-oriented position where accuracy and efficiency are both measured and valued.
Overall Responsibilities:
Manage the training data and other assets that feed the automated components of classification. Cultivate training updates for new categories or improvements.
Establish and analyze production machine learning metrics via data audits.
Liaise with Data Science subject matter experts to improve machine learning algorithm effectiveness.
Develop proficiency in Checkout’s hierarchy and data flow from Collection, Classification, Processing and Reporting.
Work with cross functional teams including Data Analysis, Engineering, Product Management to delivery high quality data in accordance with Checkout Data hierarchy.
Ability to work with varying levels of data detail, the position will work on macro-level analysis as well as low level classification.
Drive process improvement in everyday work and enforce process standardization.
Work in a highly collaborative environment with minimal supervision.
Problem solving abilities to meet reasonable but aggressive deadlines.
Qualifications:
BA/BS or equivalent.
Experience with data analysis and data science statistical and analytic technique preferred.
Strong attention to detail.
Experience in data processing environment, retailer knowledge, category/industry knowledge and consumer/category knowledge a plus.
Ability to flex and adapt to changing business needs.
Effective communication, problem solving and decision-making skills.
Improvement mindset displayed on projects.
Ability to multitask and meet strict deadlines.
Embraces teamwork & possesses ability to effectively work cross functionally.
Strong MS Office skills (Excel, Word, Outlook).

Title: Data Scientist/Data Analyst
Location: Hybrid remote in New Haven, CT 06511
Descriptions:
EMPLOYER INFORMATION:
Clifford Beers is a mental health clinic serving children and families. Our mission is to provide integrated services addressing mental, physical, and social determinants in order to improve health, resiliency and quality of life for children, families and communities.
The Integrated Care for Kids (InCK) Model, a federal grant awarded through CMS, is a child-centered local service delivery and state payment model that aims to reduce expenditures and improve the quality of care for children under 21 years of age and pregnant women covered by Medicaid through prevention, early identification, and treatment of behavioral and physical health needs.
PURPOSE:
The Data Scientist/Data Analyst is responsible for researching and coordinating data collection and data sharing processes to meet CMS and other state standards and requirements. This position will gather relevant information to facilitate decision making for the development of needs assessments, performance measures, and corresponding data collection processes. This position is a core member of the InCK team and reports to the Vice President of Data Operations.
Key Responsibilities:
Manage, reconcile, clean, analyze, and report client data across multiple databases -- including Excel, Access, SPSS, GoogleSheets, and electronic health records -- to inform system of care development.
Research, compile, and summarize supporting documents for use in performance measure development, needs assessments, and collection of core child services data.
Coordinate data workflows and collection processes within technology platforms to ensure accurate and efficient reporting.
Compile and clean data for sharing with CMS to meet required reporting requirements.
Inform and create data sharing standards, including file formats, templates, and other technical requirements, to build the infrastructure for optimal extraction, transformation and loading data from a wide variety of data sources.
Manage the secure transfer of data between key stakeholders.
Work with InCK staff and providers to create meaningfully segmented reports to promote performance management processes, including quality assurance, increase survey completion rates, and improve client outcomes.
Assess and increase efficiency of reporting processes, including automation of data processing tasks.
Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into key business performance metrics.
Conduct collaborative research with internal colleagues or external partners.
Investigate and catalog external data sources available, including state and national databases.
Present reports and findings to a variety of audiences (staff, community providers, families, and conferences)
Collect data and input information into database for review and analysis
Mentor and train staff in data processes and interpretation
Assist manager and InCK team in other related duties as directed
EDUCATION and EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor’s degree in Public Health, Psychology, Sociology, Engineering/Computer Science or related quantitative field
Experience in Project Management.
3+ years background in healthcare industry (preferred).
COMPETENCIES:
Must demonstrate the following competencies:
● Diversity and Inclusion:
Foster an environment in which all members of the organization/agency community, from staff to providers, partners and clients (HUSKY Health), are treated equitably and are able to contribute fully and meaningfully to the mission of the organization/agency.
● Be committed to advancing Health Equity and trauma-informed anti-racist activities, including but not limited to participating in training and collaborating in related workgroups.
Employees must make every effort to:
o Treat others with respect
o Practice cultural humility
o Elicit and welcome different points of view
o Uphold trauma-informed and anti-racist practices
● Integrity:
Act ethically with honesty and consistency regardless of the situation. Employees must make every effort to:
o Be accountable for his/her/their own actions
o Make decisions based on what is better for the families and employees
o Build and maintain trust among co-workers and our families
o Uphold honesty in all actions
● Excellence:
Commitment to deliver outstanding practices in both managing the organization, service delivery, and collaborating with partners. Employees must make every effort to:
o Utilize data and research to provide the highest quality of care
o Regularly participate in professional development to stay current with the most recent and progressive “best” practices
o Promote continuous quality assessment and improvement
● Communication:
The ability to express oneself clearly and professionally both in writing, conversations, and in nonverbal communication with others. Employees must make every effort to:
Oral Communication
o Speak clearly and in an organized manner that can be easily understood
o Express ideas concisely and respectfully
o Summarize or paraphrase his/her/their understanding of what others have said to verify understanding and prevent miscommunication
o Hold herself/himself/themselves accountable for pitch, speed, tone and volume of voice while speaking
o Show understanding of professional and cultural implications of body posture, stance, gestures, proximity to listener, facial expressions and appearance
Written Communication
o Write clear and concise sentences devoid of grammatical and spelling errors
o Tailor writing style to the audience of the message
o Write in a respectful and tactful manner
SKILLS:
Familiarity with Data Modeling/Mapping and implementing them in development
Experience with Agile development methodologies and tools to iterate quickly on product changes, developing user stories and working through backlog
Proficiency in one or more of the following languages, SQL, R, Python a plus
Proficiency in ACCESS a plus
Detail-oriented with exceptional accuracy and organizational skills.
Experience working with large data sets.
Ability to work with clinical and management teams and provide support for their work. Must be willing to work in a team environment and adhering to existing protocols and standards.
Proven excellent writing and presentation skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced work environment that demands a rapid turnaround of analysis and reporting and a high accuracy rate.
Very team oriented
As an organization committed to Anti-Racist practice, we strongly encourage people of color, LGBTQ+, veterans, parents, and individuals with disabilities to apply. In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example- she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc.)
If you need reasonable accommodations at any point during the interview process, please let us know.
We are an equal opportunity employer who will welcome everyone to our team!
Job Type: Full-time

Employee discount
Health insurance

Healthcare Industry: 3 years (Required)

Title: Image Research Scientist
Descriptions:
Maxar is seeking an Image Research Scientist to join our team in Ypsilanti, Michigan.
_
The Sensor Programs team develops specialized, innovative new sources of geospatial data, analytic methods, software and engineering services. Our work transforms how customers support global mapping and intelligence missions at scale, revealing unique information and insights. We contribute to integrated space solutions by harnessing and applying disruptive technologies.
_
Benefits:
Work-life balance to include flexible working opportunities and generous time off.
Family-first benefits like adoption reimbursement, pet insurance and mental health resources.
Educational perks such as student loan repayment, paid certifications and tuition reimbursement.
Career growth opportunities including an internal mobility program and leadership training and development.
Diversified healthcare and investment options including multiple medical plans, a stock purchase program and 401(k).
_
Our signal and image processing experts focus on science rather than efficiency and prototype their ideas in Python or MATLAB; once validated, we integrate their results into our operational software baseline, reusing existing components where possible.
_
Required Qualifications:
Must be a U.S. Citizen
Bachelor's a minimum of 2 years of related experience
or MS or PhD degree without professional experience
Degree must be in Optics, Electrical Engineering, or related field
Experience with coding tools Python or MATLAB
_
We are at the forefront of pioneering novel imaging systems that include state-of-the-art hardware, algorithms, and processing, enabling new remote sensing concepts and systems. Our teams integrate highly talented individuals with backgrounds in engineering, physics and software development, who work together to build solutions for users in the defense and intelligence communities. We solve tough problems and are looking for like-minded research and developers to grow our team and address new challenges.
_
Preferred Skills:
An understanding of optical phenomenology.
An understanding of image formation and imaging systems.
Ability to perform research and development of novel and advanced imaging systems: Examples include coherent and incoherent, active and passive, spectral, and polarimetric systems.
Experience with optical laboratory hardware and an ability to design imaging sensor systems, which may include optical elements, detector arrays, electronics, actuators, cooling systems, etc.
Ability to develop and exercise computer algorithms to quantify performance of imaging systems as a function of key parameters and organize results in clear presentations.
Ability to obtain a TS/SCI with CI polygraph security clearance
_
We work at a modern R&D facility near Ann Arbor, Michigan. The city and its surroundings receive consistently high national rankings as a best place to live, with outstanding educational opportunities (K-12 and major universities); a laid-back, college-town vibe, well-suited to all ages and lifestyles; affordable housing; easy commutes; an educated and skilled workforce; numerous high-tech employers; social, cultural and sporting events; and ready access to nearby outdoor recreation, including the rest of Michigan, the Great Lakes, and the Midwest. We enjoy the diversity of a moderate, four-season climate.
_
#cjpost

$88,000.00 - $146,000.00 annually.

Title: Business Operations Analyst
Descriptions:
At PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL), we believe that every person has the right to participate fully in the global economy. Our mission is to democratize financial services to ensure that everyone, regardless of background or economic standing, has access to affordable, convenient, and secure products and services to take control of their financial lives.
Job Description Summary: PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL) is committed to democratizing financial services and empowering people and businesses to join and thrive in the global economy. Our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 361 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways, whether they are online, on a mobile device, in an app, or in person. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying, or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Venmo, Braintree, Honey, and Xoom, enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies, and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.We are looking for a Business Operations Analyst to join the Strategic Marketing Enablement team in the Marketing organization. The ideal candidate has strong attention to detail, process and project management experience and analytical acumen. In this role you will be a key member of the Strategic Marketing Enablement team, working with the segment business operations leads and partners to deliver operational excellence across workforce planning reporting, training and process management for onboarding and vendor management, and supporting M&A integration programs. We are looking for an ambitious and self-directed operations analyst to join our efforts in creating a high-impact and well-managed business operations function for the marketing organization. This is a unique opportunity to partner across functions and segments to influence the operations of a global marketing organization and impact the operations and engagement of a rapidly growing business.
Job Description:
Primary Responsibilities
Deliver and optimize monthly Business Operations reporting, including workforce planning, budget and key business activities summaries for the CMO and Marketing Leadership team
Support and optimize management of external workforce relationships in partnership with Sourcing and Financial Operations teams
Manage Marketing organization adherence to mandatory compliance training timelines and reporting
Build and manage the training and support programs for the marketing organization, including new hire onboarding training, legal and sourcing training and best practices for vendor management interactions
Project management support to facilitate the M&A integration activities of acquired businesses into the marketing organization’s systems, tools and processes
Build best practices into ongoing interactions with functional partners and support training the Marketing organization to adhere to these best practices
Support ad hoc priorities and initiatives as needed in partnership with the Director of Marketing Enablement and HR, Finance and Analytics partners
Experience and Skills
3-6 years experience in operations and project management in a fast-moving environment
Proven analytical aptitude and advanced excel skills to aid the development and pursuit of growth-oriented ideas.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a history of hands-on, detail-oriented work
Ability to articulate and manage KPIs using metrics to drive performance and provide data in support of key decisions
A get things done attitude with the ability to pursue work independently and manage high quality results with little oversight.
Excitement for working in a fast-paced environment with high level of ambiguity and change
Strong desire for continuous improvement as well as a personal, lifelong learner mentality
Strong orientation to collaboration and partnership with peers and partners across the organization

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst - Remote
Descriptions:
Are you ready to work for a company that knows our overall success is a combined effort - when you succeed, we succeed. Are you ready for opportunities to learn, grow and thrive? Then read on...
Sensaria is the world’s foremost producer of grand and large-format digital graphics. We are an industry leader in creating innovative products for wall decor, art reproduction, and the professional photography and art communities. Our combined 600k+ square feet of manufacturing facilities across the United States house over 180 grand and large format digital printers, custom automated finishing equipment, and coating capabilities to produce
printed recyclable materials up to 16 ft. wide. Our prepress department processes more than 50,000 files per day with the aid of proprietary software automation tools. We operate around-the-clock, 7 days a week to deliver extraordinary customer service, and print over 400 million square feet of material annually. We specialize in industry leading innovations accompanied by world-class service.

We have an exciting opportunity for a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to join our team. The Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst will support all entities and divisions within Circle Graphics - Sensaria by managing data retrieval and analysis within the organization. This person will utilize the company’s SAP B1 ERP, BigQuery, Looker, and various other systems to organize data points and communicate to departments based on the company’s needs. The role consists of supporting an SAP database environment and will be critical to design and build sequel queries within SAP to report on company performance and key metrics. This position will enable and enhance Circle Graphics’ financial planning and reporting capabilities and will deliver the planning and analytical business requirements while ensuring high quality solutions that meet current and anticipated business needs.

This role will work on the implementation of planning and analytics solutions focused on integrating data from multiple data sources (SAP and Non-SAP tools) to support financial analysis and building the annual operating plan of the company.

This role will also assist with the integration of acquisitions into Circle Graphics’ SAP platform.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Work closely with leadership and functional teams to understand and define system requirements and recommend technical solutions to meet business needs.
Design, develop and implementation of SAP B1 planning and reporting solutions.
Develop queries and analytical solutions using B1, BigQuery, Looker, Tableau
Design and develop ways to automate ongoing reporting requirements and update reporting metrics.
Responsible for data retrieval from various systems utilizing best practices to support effective analytics performance.
Mentor resources and share expertise/best practices on systems function, design, and capabilities
Develop training tools and documentation to provide to various users.
Introduce best practice and process improvement ideas wherever appropriate.
Integrate financial reporting and month end close processes of future acquisitions into SAP B1, pending the full migration onto SAP.
Assist with driving synergies by migrating existing business not on the SAP platform into SAP.

Additional Duties and Responsibilities

Assist with optimization and implementation of SAP system as needed to scale the business.
Other duties and special projects as assigned.
Education and Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in business or Computer Science
5+ years of experience as a business intelligence analyst, sequel query expert, or related field
Familiarity of SAP B1/ HANA a significant plus
Excellent skills in SQL script to answer immediate business requirements.
Proficiency with BI visualization tools and dashboards such as BigQuery, Looker, Tableau
Must be authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship
H iring Range: $ 8 3 , 1 00 - $1 0 0,600 DOE
Location: Remote or Longmont, CO
Travel: 20% business travel required

Benefits offered: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Disability Coverage, a variety of optional benefits, Cafeteria 125 flex spending accounts, and a 401(k)-retirement plan PTO/Sick, Bonus opportunity.
Come join the leaders in digital printing and start your new career today! Please visit us at careers@circlegraphicsonline.com. We are excited to start this new adventure together!

Title: Data Engineer
Descriptions:
Senior Data Engineer
Remote
Bethesda, MD, US
Salary: USD $101,575 – $173,341 / yr
Job description
Overview
The Company
We are seeking an experienced Senior Data Engineer to join our team of talented professionals. This position is a remote opportunity.
Supporting 70% of the mortgage-backed securities in the market, We provides best-in-class single-family issuance, bond administration, disclosure, and tax services. We support a broad portfolio of products for our clients with full lifecycle management.
Our market-leading, cloud-based, end-to-end platform executes transactions on an extraordinary scale which has bolstered liquidity in the secondary mortgage market, one of the largest and most important financial markets in the world. Our unique approach to securitization combines the best minds in financial services with the know-how, flexibility, and innovation of leading technologists
Responsibilities
Job Information
The Data Engineer is responsible for solution engineering of enterprise scale data management best practices. This includes patterns such as - modern data integration frameworks, building of scalable distributed systems using emerging cloud-based data design patterns. This role will be responsible for developing data integration tasks in data and analytics space. This position will report to director of data management group under Data Operations organization. This is an individual performer role.
Key Job Functions
Demonstrate expert ability in implementing Data Warehouse solutions using Snowflake.
Building data integration solutions between transaction systems and analytics platform.
Expand data integration solutions to ingest data from internal and external sources and to further transform as per the business consumption needs
Create security policies in Snowflake to manage fine grained access control
Develop tasks for a multitude of data patterns, e.g., real-time data integration, Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, BI and Reporting.
Lead POC efforts to build foundational AI/ML services for Predictive Analytics.
Building of data products by data enrichment and ML.
Be a team player and share knowledge with the existing team members.
Qualifications
Education
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related field
Minimum Experience
Minimum of 8 years of experience in building data driven solutions.
Applicants must be authorized to work in the US without requiring employer sponsorship currently or in the future. We does not offer H-1B sponsorship for this position.
Specialized Knowledge & Skills
Expertise in real-time data solutions, good to have knowledge of streams processing, Message Oriented Platforms and ETL/ELT Tools.
Strong scripting experience using Python
Working knowledge of foundational AWS compute, storage, networking and IAM.
AWS scripting experience using lambda functions and knowledge of CloudFormation is nice to have.
Hands on experience with popular cloud-based data warehouse platforms, viz. Redshift, Snowflake.
Experience with one or more data integration tools viz. Attunity (Qlik), AWS Glue ETL, Talend, Kafka etc.
Strong understanding of data security – authorization, authentication, encryption, and network security.
Experience in building data pipelines with related understanding of data ingestion, transformation of structured, semi-structured and unstructured data across cloud services
Demonstrated ability to be self-directed with excellent organization, analytical and interpersonal skills, and consistently meet or exceed deadline deliverables.
Demonstrated experience in data management with a strong understanding of process re/design.
Strong communication skills to facilitate meetings and workshops to collect data, functional and technology requirements, document processes, data flows, gap analysis, and associated data to support data management/governance related efforts.
Knowledge and understanding of data standards and principles to drive best practices around data management activities and solutions.
Strong understanding of the importance and benefits of good data quality, and the ability to champion results across functions.
Ability to lead collaborative meetings which result in clearly documented outcomes, a concrete understanding of meeting attendee performance/reliability, and ongoing management & follow-up for action items.
Acts with integrity and proactively seeks ways to ensure compliance with regulations, policies, and procedures.
