Pay: From $1.00 per year
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Work Location: One location

Title: Inventory Analyst
Descriptions:
The Inventory Analyst provides data, guidance and direction to effectively manage inventory, cycle counting, KanBan, scrap, raw material, slow moving and obsolete inventory within or between departments according to customer demand. Duties include reviewing and distributing inventory reports and maintaining work instructions and SOP in accordance with the company’s ISO 13485:2016 Quality Management System. Serves as liaison with Accounting department to conduct financial analyst, trending and physical inventory support.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
· Conduct, monitor and report on inventory transactions to assure availability and accuracy:
· Physical accountability of inventory
· Moving, disposition, etc of slow moving and obsolete inventory
· Periodic review of Resource and Inventory allocations in MS Dynamic GP to verify accuracy
· Perform periodic cycle counts of various inventory groups per schedule
· Research and troubleshoot quantity discrepancies
· Confirm and update UOMs (Unit of Measure) for materials purchased.
· Monitor and anticipate inventory needs based on product seasonal demand and mix.
· Managing raw material levels, consumables, etc for each work cell to prevent stock outs. Adjust min/max levels for KanBans to match demand.
· With procurement, assist in processing MRP reports and review for accuracy.
· Create or amend work instructions and SOPs (Standard Operating Procedure) to aid in inventory management.
· Achieve and maintain inventory accuracy goals for different classes of parts, components and sub-assemblies.
· Manage scrap report and make appropriate inventory adjustments in ERP to account for items.
· Assist and take part in demand forecasting and material planning.
· Verify returned goods to ensure all items have been received, recorded and reported.
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE
Four-year college degree; or equivalent experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience required.
· Be able to work proficiently in MS Office applications
· Experience in MRP and ERP systems

Title: Library Supervisor
Descriptions:
Salary
$23.49 - $29.34/hour; $48,859.20 - $61,027.20/year + $1,000/mo Tahoe Assignment Premium

Department
Library

Job Type
Open - Tahoe Area

Date Opened
3/24/2023 08:00:00 AM

Filing Deadline
Open Until Filled

Employment Type
Permanent/Full Time (40 hrs/week)
Permanent/Part Time (less than 40 hrs/week)

Work Location
Tahoe (Carnelian Bay, Kings Beach, Tahoe City, Tahoe Vista, Truckee)

Additional Forms Required
Veterans DD214 (if applicable)

HR Analyst
Jed Stephenson

Introduction


Placer County is comprised of over 1,400 square miles of beautiful and diverse geography, ranging from the residential and commercial areas of South Placer, through the historic foothill areas of Auburn, Foresthill, and Colfax, and to the County's jewel of the North Lake Tahoe basin. Placer is a great place to live, work, play, and learn!
This classification is scheduled to receive general wage increases of 4% in July 2023 and 4% in July 2024.
POSITION INFORMATION
The Placer County Library is currently hiring for two (2) Library Supervisor positions in the beautiful Kings Beach and Tahoe City Libraries. The eligible list established as a result of this recruitment may be used to fill future vacancies as they arise, subject to position-specific requirements.

Tahoe Branch Assignment Premium: Salary plus up to an additional $1,000 per month Tahoe Branch Assignment Premium for employees who are permanently assigned to a position located in the North Lake Tahoe Area.
BENEFITS
Placer County offers a comprehensive benefits package to employees, including:
Holidays: 14 paid holidays per year, 2 of which are floating holidays*
Vacation leave: 10 days/year with ability to accrue 25 days/year
Sick leave: 12 days/year*
Cafeteria plan: 6% of employee’s salary will be contributed towards employee to use towards 401(k), dependent care, medical co-insurance, or cash
Medical, dental, and vision insurance available for employees and dependents
$50,000 life insurance policy at no cost to employee
CalPERS retirement plans
Retiree medical insurance
Deferred compensation
Education allowance: up to $1,200 per year
Bilingual incentive: incumbents may be eligible for bilingual incentive pay depending upon operational needs and certification of proficiency.
Amounts will be prorated for part-time employees and employees hired after the first of the year.
The information above represents benefits currently available to permanent Placer County employees and may be subject to change. Applicants should inquire about the most current benefit package during hiring interviews or by contacting the Human Resources Department. For a detailed listing of benefits, please

DEFINITION
To plan, organize, direct and supervise library operations; to supervise clerical staff within an assigned library division, program or public service unit; and to perform a variety of tasks relative to assigned area of responsibility.
DISTINGUISHING CHARACTERISTICS
The supervisor level recognizes positions that perform full, first-line supervisory responsibilities including planning, assigning, and evaluating the work of subordinates and being responsible for daily operations in assigned library division, program or public service unit. Successful performance of the work requires the use of independence, initiative, and discretion within established guidelines.
This class is distinguished from the Library Clerk – Journey by the assignment of the more complex lead first line supervisory duties and/or the oversight for the day- to- day operation of a small library division, program or public service unit of the County’s Library system.
SUPERVISION RECEIVED AND EXERCISED
Receives direction from para-professional, professional and/or management staff.
Exercises direct supervision over clerical personnel and volunteers.

EXAMPLES OF ESSENTIAL DUTIES
Duties may include, but are not limited to, the following:
Recommend and assist in the implementation of division, program or public service unit goals and objectives; establish work schedules and implement policies and procedures.
Plan, prioritize, assign, supervise and review the work of customer service staff. Evaluate operations and activities of assigned responsibilities; recommend improvements and modifications; prepare various reports on operations and activities.
Open and close a library unit; and train and oversee clerical staff and volunteers when assigned.
Assist library para-professional and professional staff with reference duties, children's programming; and other programs; gives instructional tours.
Conduct routine to complex circulation activities, including checking library materials in and out, registering and issuing cards, calculating and collecting fines and fees, shelving, and explaining County library circulation policies and procedures.
Assist customers with research and computer-related questions, e-mail, Wi-Fi, and websites; perform basic troubleshooting on various devices, and e-readers.
Represent the department to outside groups and organizations.
Compute, collect, receipt, and record monies collected for overdue, lost, or damaged materials.
Assist customers in using library services; direct customers in locating library materials; provide technical assistance and readers advisory using library resources.
Recommend new materials; maintain collection, including weeding shelves of outdated materials.
Maintain, and compile statistics on library activities, programming, and materials as directed.
Receive library materials donations and in accordance with the Collection Development Policy.
Perform general clerical duties as necessary and operate library related office equipment.
Keep library neat and clean; set up and maintain displays.
Conduct various special activities such as story hours, summer reading programs, classroom visits, and various outreach functions as assigned.
Build and maintain positive working relationships with co-workers, other County employees, and the public using principles of good customer service.
Perform related duties as assigned.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Experience and Training
Any combination of experience and training that would provide the required knowledge and abilities is qualifying. A typical way to obtain the required knowledge and abilities would be:
Experience: Three (3) years of responsible library experience performing duties comparable to a Library Clerk – Journey with Placer County.
Training: Equivalent to the completion of the twelfth (12th) grade supplemented by college level course work in business administration, public administration, library science or technology, or related field.
Required License or Certificate:
May need to possess a valid driver's license as required by the position. Proof of adequate vehicle insurance and medical clearance may also be required.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES
Knowledge of:
Principles of supervision, training and performance evaluations.
General public library services, organization, and functions, including the technical library support areas.
Methods of conducting storytelling for children.
Library materials and general reference sources.
Library classification, cataloging, and bibliographic terminology.
Applicable federal, state, and local laws, codes, and regulations.
Business arithmetic, including percentages and decimals.
Principles and techniques for working with groups and fostering effective team interaction to ensure teamwork is conducted smoothly.
Techniques for providing a high level of customer service by effectively interacting with the public, vendors, and County staff.
English usage and spelling.
Office methods, practices, procedures, and equipment, including filing and computer systems.
Principles and practices of work safety.
Ability to:
Plan, organize, assign, supervise, and coordinate the work of clerical library staff and volunteers.
Provide staff leadership and work direction.
Train staff in work procedures.
Solve problems related to library operations and procedures with direction from higher level staff.
Independently perform advanced circulation and customer service library work.
Perform a variety of complex library work with speed and accuracy, including use of integrated library system and automation.
Conduct storytelling activities when providing children services program activities.
Understand, interpret, and apply all pertinent laws, codes, regulations, policies and procedures, and standards relevant to work performed.
Work with various cultural and ethnic groups in a tactful and effective manner.
Organize work, set priorities, meet critical deadlines, and follow-up on assignments.
Act quickly and calmly in emergency situations.
Obtain information through interviews; work fairly and courteously with the public; work effectively with interruptions.
Use integrated library system, automation, computer, internet, calculator, telephone, fax machine, copier machine, and other library related equipment.
Communicate clearly and concisely, both orally and in writing.
Establish and maintain effective working relationships with those contacted in the course of work.
Work weekend and evening shifts as assigned.
On a continuous basis, sit at desk and/or stand at counter for long periods of time. Intermittently bend, twist, kneel or squat while shelving, opening boxes, or moving equipment; twist and reach office equipment; see and read print; write and use keyboard to communicate and to enter circulation and collection data; perform simple and power grasping and fine manipulation; lift moderate weight.
SELECTION PROCEDURE
Training & Experience Rating (100%)
Based upon responses to the supplemental questionnaire, the applicant’s education, training, and experience will be evaluated using a pre-determined formula. Scores from this evaluation will determine applicant ranking and placement on the eligible list.
CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT
Prior to the date of hire, applicants must undergo a fingerprint test by the Department of Justice, pass a medical examination (which may include a drug screening and possibly a psychological evaluation), sign a constitutional oath, and submit proof of U.S. citizenship or legal right to remain and work in the U.S. For some positions, applicants may also be required to submit proof of age, undergo a background investigation (which may include a voice stress analysis and/or a polygraph), and/or be bonded. Additionally, positions in law enforcement classifications and those supporting law enforcement functions will be required to complete a conviction history questionnaire prior to or during the interview process. Applicants for positions with access to Medi-Cal billing software or who are licensed providers must clear the Federal Exclusion List, credentialing, and social security verification. Failure to clear these requirements may result in an employment offer being withdrawn.
SUBSTITUTE LISTS
The eligible list resulting from this recruitment may be certified as a substitute list for a substantially similar classification. For this purpose, a substantially similar classification is one at a lower level in the same classification (example: entry level vs. journey level) and/or a similar classification (similar work performed, similar training and experience qualifications required). If you are contacted for an interview by a County department, you will be informed of the classification and other relevant information. If you choose not to interview for a substantially similar classification, you will remain on the eligible list for which you originally applied.
EMPLOYEES OF OTHER PUBLIC AGENCIES
Placer County offers an expedited process for qualifying certain applicants for interviews. Candidates currently employed, or employed within the last year, by a public agency operating under a personnel civil service or merit system may be eligible to be placed on a Public Agency Eligible List and certified as eligible for appointment to a similar job assignment without going through the examination process.
EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER
Thank you for your interest in employment with Placer County. Placer County is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to an active nondiscrimination program. It is the stated policy of Placer County that harassment, discrimination, and retaliation are prohibited and that all employees, applicants, agents, contractors, and interns/volunteers shall receive equal consideration and treatment. All terms and conditions of employment, including but not limited to recruitment, hiring, transfer, and promotion will be based on the qualifications of the individual for the positions being filled regardless of gender (including gender identity and expression), sexual orientation, race (including traits historically associated with race, including, but not limited to, hair texture and protective hairstyles such as braids, locks, and twists), color, ancestry, religion (including creed and belief), national origin, citizenship, physical disability (including HIV and AIDS), mental disability, medical condition (including cancer or genetic characteristics/information), age (40 or over), marital status, military and/or veteran status, sex (including parental status, pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, and related medical conditions), reproductive health decision making, political orientation, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law. Please contact the Human Resources Department at least 5 working days before a scheduled examination if you require accommodation in the examination process. Medical disability verification may be required prior to accommodation.
Conclusion
For questions regarding this recruitment, please contact Jennifer Tucker, Administrative Technician, at JMTucker@placer.ca.gov or (530) 886-4667.

Title: Environmental Specialist/Wetland Scientist
Descriptions:
ES&A provides natural resource assessment and environmental permitting services for municipalities, industry and private developers. We work daily with local, state, and federal regulators to address the site assessment, permitting and planning needs of our clients. ES&A offers specialties in wetland assessment, botany, environmental permitting and Endangered Species Act compliance. We have completed hundreds of projects in Oregon and Washington since founding in 2000.
Environmental Science & Assessment is looking for a full experienced Environmental Specialist/Wetland Scientist who enjoys working collaboratively on a variety of natural resources projects. This individual will work primarily in a support role to senior staff on wetland or wildlife habitat documentation, including field data collection, data entry, graphic production, online mapping research. Position is non-exempt hourly with flexible schedule.
Qualifications:
Minimum of Bachelor’s degree in botany, biology, or related field
Minimum of 2-4 years of natural resource technical support (public agency experience may be included)
Pacific Northwest plant community knowledge
Experience with riparian restoration
Demonstrated experience in field data collection.
Excellent organizational and verbal/written communication skills.
Assemble, write, and edit technical reports and prepare support graphic exhibits.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office programs
Familiar with data transfer of Trimble GPS to base surveys
Familiar with QGIS
Salary: Commensurate with experience. Generous employee benefits include employer-covered health insurance, paid holidays, 401k, and PTO.
Send resume and cover letter describing your experience via email (reply to this ad). No phone calls please. Target start date will be end of April. We will be reviewing applications through next month, but preference will be given to those received by April 14.

Title: Senior Scientist, LNP Formulations
Descriptions:
Sr. Scientist/Principal Scientist, Formulation Discovery - LNP
Company: 76Bio, Inc.
Location: Boston, MA
76Bio is seeking a highly motivated and talented formulation scientist to help build a delivery platform to realize the potential of our TPD platform. The individual will work closely with the medicinal chemistry team to design novel lipid nanoparticles for efficient delivery to tumors. They will help develop and drive the formulation strategy. They will be accountable for mentoring the rest of the formulation discovery team in designing and executing experiments to optimize processes and compositions, aimed at improving the biological activity and manufacturability of the delivery vehicles. They will be an integral member of a cross functional team, providing interpretation of data and contributing to the strategic direction of the project.
Key Responsibilities:
· Work with the medicinal chemistry team to design and execute on a formulation strategy for testing new lipid components
· Design and develop optimal formulation processes and compositions to improve LNP delivery to tumor
· Manufacture and perform bio-physical characterization of LNPs for in vitro and in vivo experiments
· Ensure efficiency of workflows and integration of high-throughput methods where feasible
· Explore alternative characterization methods to aid in building our structure function relationships
· Collaborate with biology colleagues on designing assays to better understand LNP biology
· Collaborate with pharmacology colleagues in testing novel LNPs in vivo and interpretation of the results
· Serve as subject matter expert in collaborations with technology partners and CDMOs ensuring quality and consistency of results
· Present formulation strategy and results to internal and external stakeholders, including executive committee and SAB
· Coordinate with colleagues on sample preparation and shipping LNP samples for testing at CROs
· Capturing and recording experimental details and analyses in a laboratory notebook
Essential Qualifications:
B.S., M.S or PhD in chemistry, chemical engineering, biomedical engineering, biology or related fields with pharmaceutical industry experience (10+ years for BS, 8+ years for MS, 2+ years PhD)
Experience in the design and development of lipid nanoparticles for oligonucleotide delivery
Demonstrated ability to design, formulate and characterize LNPs
Experience with a variety of analytical techniques (DLS, HPLC, SEC, SAXs, etc.)
Familiarity with micro-fluidic techniques and experience in manufacturing
Ability to collaborate effectively both within and across teams
Must be organized, self-motivated, proactive, work well under pressure and deadlines, and detail oriented
Ability to multi-task and coordinate work on several simultaneous projects
Interested applicants should submit a CV and cover letter to careers-at-76bio.com.
About Our Company:
76Bio is a preclinical-stage biotechnology company that engineers highly specific targeted protein degradation (TPD) therapeutics for previously undruggable targets, with an initial focus on biologically validated targets in oncology. Our mission is to develop transformational therapies for patients with life-threatening diseases.

Title: IT & Data Policy Analyst (TS/SCI)
Descriptions:
Tau Six, an agile small company delivering cutting edge cybersecurity and systems integration services to the US National Security market, has an immediate need for an experienced IT & Data Policy Analyst for a Department of Defense customer. In this role you have the opportunity to help shape policy across cloud, cybersecurity, and operations for future national security IT systems.

The IT & Data Policy Analyst will assist Tau Six customers craft, edit, and coordinate approvals of large-scale information technology policies. The ideal candidate is a motivated, career and customer-oriented, experienced information technology and cybersecurity policy professional with Department of Defense and/or U.S. Intelligence Community experience. Candidates must have excellent written communication skills.
CLEARANCE REQUIRED: Active Top Secret / SCI US Government clearance
Responsibilities
Provide support to DoD CIO leadership on information technology, cybersecurity, and data policy, processes, and standards.
Author draft DoD policy issuances and policy memoranda.
Work with technology and data subject matter experts to develop policies that drive transformation to data-centric operations.
Coordinate formal and informal stakeholder comment review and revision of DoD policy issuances and policy memoranda.
Participate, and support DoD customer participation, in internal and external policy working groups and meetings.
Provide recommendations to DoD customer on new and improved policy artifacts to improve DoD mission enablement and delivery.
Assist in DoD correspondence management processes used to communicate tasking and guidance across the Department.
Requirements
Excellent formal written communication skills and the ability to author both short- and long-form documents.
Experience in Department of Defense or U.S. Government policy issuance activities, policy memoranda, and/or standards development.
Experience with SQL, Phyton, Palantir, or Advana
Knowledge of data analysis / data science principles
Keen customer service skills, especially in supporting senior DoD officials.
Ability to synthesize complex policy and technical matters into clear, effective policy documents written in accordance with U.S. Government “plain language” requirements.
Experience with DoD policy issuance process a strong differentiator.
Requires Bachelor's degree or equivalent and 5 or more years related experience.

Title: Senior Financial Analyst
Descriptions:
The Senior Financial Analyst is responsible for tracking the company’s financial performance against a plan, analyzing business performance and market conditions to create forecasts, and helping senior management make tactical and strategic decisions by providing periodic reports. This job description indicates the general nature and level of the work that is expected. It is not designed to contain a comprehensive or all-inclusive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities. Other duties may be required.
Primary Responsibilities
Provide monthly, quarterly and year-end analysis and reports for Senior Management
Coordinate month-end close process and manage all aspects of the general ledger
Prepare account reconciliations during month-end close
Assist with the annual and quarterly budgeting and forecasting processes
Identify opportunities for performance improvement across the organization
Researching accounting issues for compliance with generally accepted accounting principles
Support Controller as a liaison to external auditors
Develop financial models that assist with decision-making
Minimum Requirements
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, or related field; CPA or CMA required.
5-7 years of relevant experience in corporate finance, financial planning & analysis, cost accounting, or other related fields including at least 3 years post designation.
Manufacturing experience a plus.
Working knowledge of IFRS a plus.
Strong working knowledge of Excel and financial modeling
Excellent analytical, decision-making, and problem-solving skills
Attention to accuracy and detail required

Title: Senior Program Analyst - Acquisition and Capabilities SME
Descriptions:
Overview:
Systems Planning and Analysis, Inc. (SPA) delivers high-impact, technical solutions to complex national security issues. With over 50 years of business expertise and consistent growth, we are known for continuous innovation for our government customers, in both the US and abroad. Our exceptionally talented team is highly collaborative in spirit and practice, producing Results that Matter. Come work with the best! We offer opportunity, unique challenges, and clear-sighted commitment to the mission. SPA: Objective. Responsive. Trusted.

SPA provides multiple organizations within the Department of Defense with timely and objective assessments and recommendations that integrate technical, operational, programmatic, policy and business analysis. We focus on key clients in the undersea community including Navy’s Strategic Systems Programs (SSP), and NAVSEA program managers for the COLUMBIA Class SSBNs and in-service submarines. We work to provide integrated solutions based on information and communications throughout the chain of command to ensure clear and consistent analysis and recommendations that are aligned to strategic and leadership goals while still being executable by the working level technical communities.

SPA has an immediate need for a Senior Program Analyst located at the Washington Navy Yard. For this position, SPA is a teammate on the Team Submarine support contract under the new SHAPM award. Team Submarine unifies submarine platform procurement activities and includes the Columbia-class SSBN program, a Major Defense Acquisition Program and the Navy’s top acquisition priority, the Virginia-class SSN program, and the new SSN-X program, developing the next generation attack submarine, bringing improved capabilities to the undersea forces. Analysts supporting Team Submarine would continue SPA’s decades of support to the SSBN force or assist in developing the design requirements for the SSN of the future. These are high-profile, major acquisition programs of significant importance to the future capabilities of the US Navy in an era of renewed strategic competition. #CJ #IN123
Responsibilities:
The Senior Program Analyst - Acquisition SME will provide analytic and management decision support directly to senior Navy leadership for undersea platform acquisition activities, focusing on the new SSN-X program. The Analyst should expect to perform detailed analysis in support of the Analysis of Alternatives and early acquisition milestones, provide executive level decision support, brief senior leaders frequently and be a key member of a high profile team.
Qualifications:
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in technical or management field
10+ years in defense programs, with subject matter expertise in defense requirements
Experience developing acquisition plans and associated documentation for new ACAT I programs
Proficient in using Microsoft Office, including Word and PowerPoint, to communicate to decision makers
Current DoD security clearance - minimum Secret, with the ability to maintain it throughout employment
Additional Qualifications Desired, but not required:
Experience working on Navy, submarine, or undersea related programs
Experience with and knowledgeable of the Navy requirements and program office organizations and processes

Title: Project Coordinator
Descriptions:
Project Coordinator
Location: Tucson, AZ, US, 85706
Req ID: 26592
Onsite or Remote: Onsite Position
Komatsu is an indispensable partner to the construction, mining, forestry, forklift, and industrial machinery markets, maximizing value for customers through innovative solutions. With a diverse line of products supported by our advanced IoT technologies, regional distribution channels, and a global service network, we tap into the power of data and technology to enhance safety and productivity while optimizing performance. Komatsu supports a myriad of markets, including housing, infrastructure, water, pipeline, minerals, automobile, aerospace, electronics, and medical, through its many brands and subsidiaries, including Joy, P&H, Montabert, Modular Mining Systems, Hensley Industries, NTC, and Gigaphoton.
Modular Mining Systems is the global leader in mine management technology and a wholly-owned subsidiary of Komatsu LTD. Our innovative technology powers mine operations in every corner of the globe. The products we cultivate, the solutions we engineer, and the service we deliver set us apart in the Mining Technology industry.
We’re more than a company, and we’re a community of passionate, creative professionals striving toward a shared vision: revolutionizing the way the mining industry operates. With a presence stretching from Johannesburg to Vancouver, Sydney to Lima, you are part of a global brand that supports creativity, fosters innovation, and encourages you to think big, share ideas and be yourself.
The Company
Modular Mining Systems is the global leader in mine management technology and a wholly owned subsidiary of Komatsu Ltd. Our innovative technology powers mine operations in every corner of the globe. The products we cultivate, the solutions we engineer, and the service we deliver set us apart in the Mining Technology industry. We’re more than a company, we’re a community of passionate, creative professionals striving toward a shared vision: to revolutionize the way the mining industry operates. With a presence stretching from Johannesburg to Vancouver, Sydney to Lima, you are part of a global brand that supports creativity, fosters innovation, and encourages you to think big, share ideas, and be yourself.
Job Purpose
The Project Coordinator will support the MTS Global PMO team with planning, execution, and delivery of deployment projects within our Mining Technology Solutions organization. You will assist project managers and team leaders to ensure products and solutions are efficiently developed and perform as intended to meet customer and business requirements.

If you consider yourself someone who can apply technical know-how, participate and contribute to a dynamic and team-oriented environment, this is a great opportunity to work side by side with some of the biggest innovators in the Mining technology industry.
Travel Requirements
Up to 10%
Job Duties and Responsibilities
Coordinating projects ensuring proper planning and execution
Assisting with project administration deliverables (i.e. meeting minutes; monthly reporting; quarterly planning; status updates…)
Supporting project managers and team leaders with monitoring project progress, proactively communicating with team members and stakeholders, detecting, and communicating risks before they impact the project plan
Embracing, promoting, and instilling an agile culture within the team
Supporting department improvements related to project management processes, tools, and resources
Required Skills
Bachelor's degree – preferably in business, engineering, or technology
1-3 years of experience managing projects
Motivated self-starter with a willingness to learn
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate in a clear concise manner
Detail oriented with the ability to comprehend and interpret instructions
Ability to analyze and solve problems
Strong time management and organizational skills
Desired Skills
Applicable training and/or certifications in project management and/or agile methodologies
Hands on experience with Microsoft Office and SharePoint administration highly desired
Understanding of product development processes, tools, methodologies, and best practices
Komatsu is an Equal Opportunity Workplace and an Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Title: Sr Claims Analyst - Casualty Specialty
Location: Jersey City, NJ 07302 (The Waterfront area)+7 locations
Descriptions:
Who we are
American International Group, Inc. (AIG) is a leading global insurance organization. AIG member companies provide a wide range of property casualty insurance in approximately 70 countries and jurisdictions. These diverse offerings include products and services that help businesses and individuals protect their assets and manage risks.
We’re also committed to making a positive difference for our colleagues and in the communities where we work and live. We encourage colleagues to give back to the causes they care most about, supporting these efforts through our Volunteer Time Off and Matching Grants Programs.
Get to know the business
General Insurance is a leading provider of insurance products and services for commercial and personal insurance customers. It includes one of the world’s most far-reaching property casualty networks. General Insurance offers a broad range of products to customers through a diversified, multichannel distribution network.
Our Claims professionals support AIG policyholders through some of the most trying times. When our clients face losses large and small, we step up to help them ease the financial burdens of catastrophic events like fires and hurricanes; we help them get their businesses back up and running again or recoup the value of a lost family heirloom or a prized possession. Our Claims team is an industry leader, drawing daily on its unparalleled levels of expertise to offer our clients the highest levels of stewardship to drive total cost of claim improvement and consistent outcomes. AIG manages claims using a wealth of technical and market knowledge about risks, business practices, and the ever-evolving legal and regulatory environment.
About the role
The Senior Casualty Claims Analyst will ensure high quality claims handling in the Casualty Specialty Claims Department. The role is responsible for making coverage determinations, investigating losses, conducting independent assessments as to the company exposure, and participating in developing and implementing cost effective litigation and action plans to move cases towards timely resolution in the handling of construction defect and abuse claims.
The AIG Casualty Specialty Department is a group of well trained and highly dedicated claim professionals with a breadth of claim handling experience primarily focusing on Construction Defect and Sexual Abuse/Molestation Reviver subject matters. We take a collaborative approach in handling large, complex claims, many of which implicate significant coverage issues. Team members excel from sharing each other’s strengths and experiences. This position provides the opportunity to engage/work with senior claim, underwriting and actuarial management as well as for growth within the department and company.
Responsibilities include:
Interpreting and applying primary and excess policy provisions according to the laws in all 50 states.
Communicating with clarity all applicable coverage defenses to our insureds, mediators, and other parties.
Managing outside counsel and review case documents. Directing defense counsel according to the rules and tools applicable to complex, multi-party litigation in all 50 states and document efforts and conclusions.
Working with experts to evaluate large, casualty specialty claims and articulate repair alternatives and document efforts and conclusions.
Establishing timely, appropriate reserves for both legal and indemnity exposures, including submission of Major Loss Reports, where required.
Negotiating maximum contributions from other parties and carriers to effect timely and equitable settlements and document efforts and conclusions.
Developing close working relationships with dedicated accounts to the mutual benefit of our customers and the company.
What we’re looking for:
3+ years of complex claims experience
Experience with litigation management strongly preferred
Bachelor's degree required; JD preferred
Experience with writing and presenting reports to senior management
Excellent time management and organizational skills
For positions based in Jersey City, NJ and Los Angeles, CA the base salary range is $64,000-$88,000. For positions based in New York City, NY and San Francisco, CA the base salary range is $61,000-$94,000. In addition, the position is eligible for a bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable incentive plan. In addition, we’re proud to offer a range of competitive benefits, a summary of which can be viewed here:
AIG Benefits Guide
#LI-HB1
A look at our Benefits
We're proud to offer a range of employee benefits and resources that help you protect what matters most - your health care, savings, financial protection and wellbeing. We provide a variety of leaves for personal, health, family and military needs. For example, our "Giving Back" program allows you to take up to 16 hours a year to volunteer in your community. Our global mental health and wellness days off provide all colleagues with a paid day off to focus on their mental health and wellbeing.

We also believe in fostering our colleagues' development and offer a range of learning opportunities for colleagues to hone their professional skills to position themselves for the next steps of their careers. We have a tuition reimbursement program for eligible colleagues to enhance their education, skills, and knowledge in areas that relate to their current position or future positions to which they may transfer or progress.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer

American International Group, Inc., its subsidiaries and affiliates are committed to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and its policies and procedures reflect this commitment. We provide equal opportunity to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, age, gender, gender expression, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected categories such as sexual orientation. At AIG, we believe that diversity and inclusion are critical to our future and our mission – creating a foundation for a creative workplace that leads to innovation, growth, and profitability. Through a wide variety of programs and initiatives, we invest in each employee, seeking to ensure that our people are not only respected as individuals, but also truly valued for their unique perspectives.
To learn more please visit:
https://www.aig.com/about-us/diversity-equity-and-inclusion

candidatecare@aig.com

Title: Service Desk Analyst
Descriptions:
Braden Business Systems, a tech driven company providing connectivity, cloud and output solutions to the Indianapolis and Chicago markets, is seeking a highly motivated, self-starter individual to join our growing corporate team.
Why Braden Business Systems?
At Braden, we are motivated by our vision for success. Our growth-driven team of energetic employees has a desire and determination to succeed. We are committed to training, encouraging, and supporting each other as we work to improve our business and grow as individuals.
Our culture is fun, fast-paced and performance driven. As a locally owned and operated company that is heavily invested in our community, we always put our employees and our customers first. Hard-working, entrepreneurial candidates that thrive both individually and as members of a team will fit in at Braden.
Other benefits of working with Braden include:
Career Advancement Opportunities
Open-Door Policy with all Members of Management
Competitive Compensation Plans
401K with Company Match
Corporate and Team Events
Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
Health Savings Account with Company Contributions
Holiday and paid time off schedule
Voluntary Short & Long-Term Disability Coverage
100% Employer Funded Group Term Life Insurance Coverage
Essential Functions of a Service Desk Analyst:
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
· First point of support for all users seeking support via telephone/voicemail, email or in person.
· Answers, evaluates, and prioritizes service requests received from users regarding issues related to their computer networks, workstations, laptops, peripherals, or handheld devices.
· Troubleshoots hardware and software problems.
· Track support tickets and complete all system documentation.
· Communicate with client remotely, mainly via phone support.
· Capability to resolve assigned service tickets without supervision.
· Ability to respond to client issues outside of normal business hours.
· Other duties as assigned.
Desired Skills and Expertise of a Service Desk Analyst:
· Prefer 1-2 years of help desk technician experience.
. Experience in Managed Services industry a plus.
· Prefer experience working from ticketing system(s).
· Experience with major hardware vendors – Dell, HP, etc.
· Updated knowledge of Microsoft Windows operating systems – desktop and server.
· Knowledge of Microsoft Applications (Office365, Teams, etc.) is a plus.
· Basic networking knowledge (DNS, switches, firewalls, VPN, etc.) is desired.
. Meraki, Ubiquiti, Spam Filtering, and/or RMM tools experience is desired.
· Troubleshooting skills are required.
· Outstanding written and verbal skills.
· Able to provide examples of above average customer service performance.
· Be part of the Tribe.

Title: Sr Analyst, Contracts - Hybrid
Location: Tucson, AZ 85756 (Tucson International Airport area)+1 location
Descriptions:
Date Posted:
2023-03-15
Country:
United States of America
Location:
AZ810: RMS AP Bldg 810 1151 East Hermans Road Building 810, Tucson, AZ, 85756 USA
Position Role Type:
Hybrid
About Us:
At Raytheon Missiles & Defense, fresh thinking and possibilities are forged in times of change and you will be on the front lines as we trailblaze new approaches, push the boundaries of innovation and chart a course to a tomorrow you can be proud to have a hand in creating.

Job Location: Tucson, AZ
Job Summary:
Raytheon Missiles and Defense (RMD) has an exciting opportunity for a Senior Contracts Analyst in the Evolved Sea Sparrow Missile (ESSM) program. You will have an opportunity to support the development of proposals, as well as administration, modification, and closure of contracts. You will interface with the customer on contracting matters and ensure that proposed and negotiated terms and conditions comply with company policies, as well as advise program management of contractual rights and obligations and means to mitigate contractual/program risks.

This role will be responsible for assisting with the development of proposals, as well as management and administration of multiple contracts. Duties include having a role in solicitation assessment, proposal coordination and reviews, negotiations, financial reviews, customer engagement and collaboration, and general contract management. Additionally, this position will be a key customer interface for contracting matters responsible for establishing and maintaining trust and cooperation while ensuring that proposed and negotiated terms and conditions comply with company policies and guidelines. This role will also advise program management of contractual rights and obligations and means to mitigate contractual/program risks.

Responsibilities to Anticipate:
Providing technical knowledge to develop innovative contracting solutions which will result in achieving program and business objectives.
Providing Request for Proposal (RFP) assessment, proposal generation, contract negotiation, contract management, and ensuring that business deals comply with company policies.
Supporting program gate reviews, program management reviews, business strategy sessions, proposal reviews, risk management, and all other contracts matters.
Developing relationships with and serving as the focal point of contact with the customers’ agents.
Shaping opinions of key stakeholders and negotiating to create the best outcomes possible.
Advising management of contractual rights and obligations; mitigating contractual and program risks; compiling and analyzing data; maintaining historical records.
Qualifications You Must Have:
The ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. government issued security clearance is required. U.S. citizenship is required, as only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearance.
Typically requires a University degree and minimum 2 years of prior relevant experience or 5 years equivalent experience without a degree.
Qualifications We Value:
Active DoD security clearance.
Knowledge of Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR), and the Defense FAR Supplement (DFARS), and equivalent U.S. Government Regulations.
Experience in change management, Requests for Equitable Adjustments (REAs), Engineering Change Proposals (ECPs), dispute resolution, and negotiations.
Experience in various contract types including internal business transactions.
Comfortable working in an environment with established company policies and procedures
Good analytical skills, excellent interpersonal skills, and excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Experience with MS Office applications.
Experience working in a fast-paced environment, where prioritization is required to be effective.
Proven record of responsiveness with excellent time management and organization skills.
Past experience in a position requiring multi-tasking and handling several assignments concurrently.
What We Offer:
Whether you’re just starting out on your career journey or are an experienced professional, we offer a robust total rewards package that goes above and beyond with compensation; healthcare, wellness, retirement and work/life benefits; career development and recognition programs. Some of the superior benefits we offer include parental (including paternal) leave, flexible work schedules, achievement awards, educational assistance and child/adult backup care.
Employee Referral Award Eligibility: Only employees currently within RMD and RI&S have the potential to receive a Referral Award for submitting a referral to RMD and RI&S roles. ALL eligibility requirements must be met (see guidelines) to receive the Referral Awarding

Title: Materials Analyst/Engineer
Descriptions:
Your Career Begins at Timken
If you're ready for a challenging career that provides you with the ability to advance personally and professionally, look to Timken. Our associates make the world more productive by improving the efficiency and reliability of the machinery that keeps industry in motion.
Purpose of Position
The objective of this position is to provide primary operating and maintenance support for heat treatment assets. The position also requires strong operating skills for additional laboratory scale equipment. Overall, this position is the lead for maintenance, operations, metallographic data collection and analysis, process data collection and analysis, safety, and essential documentation.
This position works closely with R&D engineers and specialists, suppliers, customers (internal and external) and project leaders to ensure that tests are executed in a timely manner and in alignment with the needs of the Business Units and Technology. This position contributes to laboratory leadership from an advanced testing perspective to include developing and conducting associated testing, maintaining a safe/clean laboratory environment, and interfacing with team members to maintain equipment.

Essential Responsibilities
Operate and maintain heat treatment asset, conduct routine maintenance, and assist with recipe development.
Operate and maintain laboratory testing equipment as requested.
Develop ideas for continuous improvement.
Evaluate metallurgical characteristics of test samples as well as conduct statistical data analysis and author test reports.
Oversee and coordinate metallurgical, mechanical testing, and process test sample preparation.
Maintain thorough and accurate documentation of testing plans, status, and results.
Conduct metallurgical testing such as microstructure, microhardness for internal and external customers through Technology Service Request (TSR) system.
Maintain communication with appropriate associates and vendors.
Cross-train in other Material Characterization Labs to provide backup.
Complete 5S audits (as assigned), maintain a clean and orderly laboratory; ensure proper machine maintenance and operation and safe storage of chemicals and fluids.

Technical/Functional Skills
Demonstrated strong problem-solving skills
Basic knowledge of materials and associated characterization techniques.
Knowledge of relevant industrial standards
Experience with production processes
Excellent technical writing and communication skills
Strong interpersonal and team skills

Minimum Qualifications:

Associate's degree in Engineering, Business or related field with 2 to 3 years of experience, or
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Business, or related field with 0 to 1 years of experience.
All qualified applicants shall be treated equally according to their individual qualifications, abilities, experiences and other employment standards. There will be no discrimination due to gender or gender identity, race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, sexual orientation, veteran/military status or any other basis protected by applicable law.

Title: MES Technical Analyst
Descriptions:
By clicking the “Apply” button, I understand that my employment application process with Takeda will commence and that the information I provide in my application will be processed in line with Takeda’s Privacy Notice and Terms of Use. I further attest that all information I submit in my employment application is true to the best of my knowledge.
Job Description
Job Title: MES Technical Analyst
Location: Covington, GA
About the role:
Actively participates in the deployment of MES at the manufacturing site by collaborating with global team and cross-functional site teams.
Acts as the MES Technical System Owner (TSO) at the manufacturing site.
Coordinates MES related activities at the site, including but not limited to, infrastructure deployment, enabling systems integration, manufacturing intelligence, and tier 1/tier 2 support.
Escalates MES support issues to Global MES Technical System Owner
How you will contribute:
Works with plant MES Business Owner to prioritize MES projects with the plant leadership team. Accountable for infrastructure and application life cycle management. Candidate will engage with MBR designer, IT Infrastructure team, and engineering to coordinate technical aspects of MES such as system interfaces and MES enhancements. Works with the Manufacturing and Automation Engineering teams to ensure plant level MES data can be consumed. Contribution to MES business intelligence reports. This role includes supporting the manufacturing site by:
Approving system changes
Escalating MES issues to Global MES Technical System Owner
Managing ServiceNow for plant MES incidents/tickets including tracking and metrics
What you bring to Takeda:
A degree in IT/Computer Science/Pharmaceutical Manufacturing or relevant field
Understanding of software project life cycle and experience in working with MES software
Five (5) years of experience in the life sciences industry on large scale applications
Strong experience in Computer System Validation (CSV) for manufacturing systems
Key Skills, Abilities, and Competencies
Computerized System Validation
Data Integrity
Application life-cycle management methodologies
ServiceNow ticket queue management
Computerized System Change Control
Owns the IT System Owner responsibilities per:
PROC-0000473, Global SOP System Development Life Cycle (SDLC)
PROC-003823, Global Standard Computerized System Validation
Complexity and Problem Solving
Identify, investigate, analyze, propose and document appropriate solutions for problems and issues that may impact the business or operations.
What Takeda can offer you:
Comprehensive Healthcare: Medical, Dental, and Vision
Financial Planning & Stability: 401(k) with company match and Annual Retirement Contribution Plan
Health & Wellness programs including onsite flu shots and health screenings
Generous time off for vacation and the option to purchase additional vacation days
Community Outreach Programs and company match of charitable contributions
Family Planning Support
Professional training and development opportunities
Tuition reimbursement
Important Considerations:
At Takeda, our patients rely on us to deliver quality products. As a result, we must follow strict rules in our manufacturing facilities to ensure we are not endangering the quality of the product. In this role, you may:
Work in a controlled environment requiring special gowning and wear protective clothing over the head, face, hands, feet and body. This may include additional hearing protection for loud areas.
Need to remove all make-up, jewelry, contact lenses, nail polish and/or artificial fingernails while in the manufacturing environment.
Work in a cold, wet environment.
Work multiple shifts, including weekends, or be asked to work supplemental hours, as necessary.
Work around chemicals such as alcohol, acids, buffers and Celite that may require respiratory protection.
More about us:
At Takeda, we are transforming patient care through the development of novel specialty pharmaceuticals and best in class patient support programs. Takeda is a patient-focused company that will inspire and empower you to grow through life-changing work.
Certified as a Global Top Employer, Takeda offers stimulating careers, encourages innovation, and strives for excellence in everything we do. We foster an inclusive, collaborative workplace, in which our teams are united by an unwavering commitment to deliver Better Health and a Brighter Future to people around the world.
This posting excludes Colorado applicants.

Title: Expert IT Business Systems Analyst (Enterprise Warehouse Management)
Descriptions:
Nestlé Information Technology is the digital arm of the world’s largest nutrition, health, and wellness company. With 150+ years in business, 2,000+ brands, and 270,000+ diverse team members—you’re joining an organization that’s revolutionizing food and championing global humanitarian efforts with technology at its core.

Joining Nestlé IT means you’ll never stop learning and sharpening new skills. Tools, technologies, and innovation for the next generation of food is part of it. Working with team members from different cultures and corners of the world on truly meaningful initiatives is what makes our work inspiring. Think beyond technology. Feel like you belong. Join a Force for Good.

Position Summary

As a REMOTE Expert IT Business Systems Analyst (Enterprise Warehouse Management), you will support the regional deployment and enhancement of the SAP MM/TM related products as well as 3PL EDI integration for Nestle Health Science. You will drive additions to the product roadmaps incorporating digital, automation, analytics, and innovation to ensure maximum business value. You will manage the regional development of the global product team. You will work with various functional leaders within North America to shape their strategies with regards to product adoption, building new capabilities, or bettering the user experience. In this role, you will also work hand in hand with the Global Supply Chain Product Owners to share best practices and ensure alignment to the global product vision and roadmap while in close collaboration with the Architects and the Business.


• Understand gaps and then working with the rest of the community to deliver solutions
Work with Functional and IT Leaders to develop their product roadmaps and consolidate into a broader NA product roadmap
Manage the regional development of the global product team as it pertains to your product roadmap
Own the user stories in the overall product backlog and is accountable for the prioritization and the overall delivery of the Product Lifecycle
Act as the regional voice back to the global IT Product Manager as well as advocates for the product within the North America, working to bridge any gaps
Take ownership of product and process pain points, then help drive to resolution (while in alignment with global Product Managers)
Meet regularly with each IT functional stream and Functional Relationship Managers to ensure they understand value of the products and look for additional opportunities

Requirements
Bachelor’s degree or higher, preferably Computer Science or field related (supply chain) to the product or equivalent experience
5+ year of professional supply chain experience with 2+ years focused on SAP EWM/WM, 3PL EDI

Other
1+ years of experience working with third party vendors
Experience with solutions managing Co-manufacturers, Business to business and Direct to consumer
Extensive working knowledge of Warehouse Management (end to end processes/ integration)
Previous experience with back-end integration of Direct to Consumer Add on (such as Shipedge) with SAP EWM/WM systems with an ERP platform

The approximate pay range for this position is $110,000 to $145,000. Please note that the pay range provided is a good faith estimate for the position at the time of posting. Final compensation may vary based on factors including but not limited to background, knowledge, skills, and abilities as well as geographic location of the position. Nestlé offers performance-based incentives and a competitive total rewards package, which includes a 401k with Company match, healthcare coverage and a broad range of other benefits. Incentives and/or benefit packages may vary depending on the position. Learn more at About Us | Making an Impact | Nestle Careers (nestlejobs.com).

Title: Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) - Chatham, NJ
Descriptions:
Overview:
Helping Hands Family (“HHF”) is an organization that provides Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) services for individuals with Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD). Our supportive, inclusive culture helps every individual reach their highest potential.

Helping Hands Family is dedicated to a supportive, inclusive culture. From growing our team to the client treatment plans, we have committed to celebrating differences and helping everyone reach their highest potential. HHF is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, sex, ancestry, citizenship status, mental or physical disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, veteran status, or military status.

Our BCBAs directly contributes to our mission of making autism services personal by overseeing the quality and implementation of clinical programming to their assigned clients. This team member will also build relationships with the clients and their local community to bring positive awareness to our business and the ASD community.
Responsibilities:
Assess levels of functioning through specific standardized assessments as well as Functional Behavioral Assessments and Functional Analyses
Develop meaningful and detailed assessments, treatment goals and programming to address the needs of each client
Provide coaching and mentoring to Behavior Techs and RBTs while overseeing implementation of programs with clients
Develop and monitor data collection for all programs being run
Conduct Parent Training on specific treatment goals that are meaningful to the family
Respond to parental concerns regarding programming and/or staffing issues by investigating, gathering information and reporting to the Clinical Director for resolution
Assist in identification of best staffing for authorized services for client needs
Communicate with the Clinical Director on a regular basis and through various scheduled meetings
Provide a weekly update email to the team, including the Clinical Director
Ensure that there are regular treatment integrity checks for all programming
Adhere to the relevant CPT codes
Provide training internally to staff on the policies and procedures of HHF
Provide training both internally and externally on clinical topics
All other duties assigned

A successful Team Member will be…
Detail-oriented & highly organized
Communicative & collaborative
Committed to purposeful care
Ambition to grow with the company

The performance evaluation is conducted by the Clinical Director.

Qualifications:

Passion for making a difference in the lives of our clients.
Valid BCBA Certification Required.
Valid State license is required
2+ years in the field of ABA (experience as an RBT or similar role will count for newly certified BCBAs).
Strong verbal and written communication skills for speaking with Clients’ families and Session Notes.
Confident communication skills for interactions with family members and caregivers of the client.
Must pass internal competency within 90 days of hire.

Title: Sr Analyst Compliance Training & Comms
Descriptions:
Join a Legacy of Innovation 110 Years and Counting!

Daiichi Sankyo Group is dedicated to the creation and supply of innovative pharmaceutical therapies to improve standards of care and address diversified, unmet medical needs of people globally by leveraging our world-class science and technology. With more than 100 years of scientific expertise and a presence in more than 20 countries, Daiichi Sankyo and its 15,000 employees around the world draw upon a rich legacy of innovation and a robust pipeline of promising new medicines to help people. Under the Group’s 2025 Vision to become a “Global Pharma Innovator with Competitive Advantage in Oncology,” Daiichi Sankyo is primarily focused on providing novel therapies in oncology, as well as other research areas centered around rare diseases and immune disorders.
Summary This position will be part of the Compliance organization and will report directly to the Director, Compliance Communications and Policy. This position will be responsible for assisting the team responsible for reporting to the Corporate Ethics & Compliance Department, Board of Directors, and other bodies as may be necessary. This position will partner with other members of the Compliance organization and will work regularly with all business areas (Sales, Marketing, Clinical, TMPC, Med Affairs, and Regulatory Affairs) and support functions (IT, Finance, HR, and Legal).

Responsibilities

Training – Through strong Project Management skills, plan, create, develop, draft and deliver various, innovative training vehicles to inform and educate employees on compliance issues through the utilization of existing and novel technological solutions (including LMS, Articulate E-Learning software, and video) in accordance with the approved Compliance Training Plan. Participate in the development and tracking of a multi-year policy procedure training curricula for use across Commercial and Development organizations; as well as external vendors and global teams, as appropriate. Serve as SME for other business units in the creation of training materials. Support Compliance department in managing training logistics (including but not limited to scheduling, scene preparation, and various pre-shoot preparatory work).

Analytics, Reporting and Communications – Develop, create and track reporting metrics as they relate to Company-wide trainings and external/global trainings, as appropriate. Maintain systems and document training curricula to ensure that only current training modules and items are available and issued. Serve as facilitator and primary point of contact for business units as it pertains to proper identification of vendors requiring specialized training. Conduct regular assessments and prepare reports/analytics of training systems with the goal of maintaining as current and accurate. Contribute to the development and execution of a communication plan (and related campaigns) supporting the team’s annual and periodic Training objectives. Prepare reports, presentations, and related materials that pertain to training objectives for use at Senior Leadership meetings.

Special Projects/Change Management – Assist the Director in the implementation of new processes, procedures and/or systems to improve organizational efficiencies and cost controls. The position is required to keep informed of industry trends and newsworthy happenings, company product pipeline progress, and overall financial position of the Company in order to provide meaningful support. Provide project management support for special Compliance projects which may include Link2 Compliance publication; annual update of training modules; creation of new training modules, etc.

- Policy -Assist the Director with the identification, creation, and dissemination of Corporate Compliance policies. Assist with the drafting of non-GxP policies and procedures, as needed and appropriate. Support the team in developing and tracking its annual and periodic Compliance policy and procedure plan, including the review and renewal of existing policies and procedures. Maintain current and accurate systems for document sharing.

Building Relationships –the position is responsible for building and managing effective business relationships throughout the DSI organization and US affiliates, learning their needs for compliance information and providing reporting support to all departments.
Qualifications: Successful candidates will be able to meet the qualifications below with or without a reasonable accommodation.
Education Qualifications (from an accredited college or university)

High School Diploma required

Bachelor's Degree Strongly preferred; Preferably in Business Administration, Accounting or Finance. In the absence of a bachelor’s degree, five years of pharmaceutical industry experience may be considered to satisfy this requirement. preferred Experience Qualifications

4 or More Years Pharmaceutical industry experience, with a strong preference for compliance and/or training experience or, in the alternative, a Bachelor’s degree. preferred

Articulate experience strongly preferred preferred
Travel: Ability to travel up to 10% Minimal

Title: Digital Marketing Consultant
Descriptions:
Today, digital marketing is so much more than SEO. We want to take your existing digital marketing knowledge and combine it with our digital marketing service and software training to turn you into the expert digital marketing specialist that we know you can be. So, if you love client-facing, constantly evolving, and truly dynamic work, please read on down.
Responsibilities
As Spectrum’s Digital Marketing Consultant, you will:
Determine what online marketing program will work best for our clients and push them to make the right steps moving forward
Execute monthly and annual audits of client websites, providing continual SEO/SEM guidance and advice
Work on behalf of our clients to create mutually beneficial partnerships with other online entities and businesses
Conduct accurate keyword analysis and ensure copy/keyword best practices
Evaluate key metrics and, in turn, implement strategies that will improve client website conversions
Follow all webmaster guidelines and deliver long-term, white hat results
Implement quality link strategies for optimal organic visibility
Work hand-in-hand with designers, developers, copywriters and PPC specialists to improve client website performance
Some Characteristics That Define You
As a Digital Marketing Account Management team member at Spectrum, you will wear many different hats in order to properly manage our clients’ needs and grow their businesses. Here are just a few different things that will define you:
Leader. You will be responsible for leading your own client’s digital marketing strategy and helping to guide your colleagues down a similar path.
Hungry. Account Management is so much more than just managing a client. It is about never settling for “just good enough”. You need to be passionate about finding new business for your clients and excited about launching new projects with them as well.
Organized. You will be in charge of multiple different accounts and multiple different projects within those accounts. In order to yield the best results for your clients, you need to keep those projects organized.
People person. You live to make your clients smile and understand how to handle them properly when you don’t.
Patient. Although we love our clients, they can be challenging and so can their projects. You’re going to have to be patient and up for that challenge.
SEO Expert/Strategist. A big factor in the success that Spectrum brings its clients is its search engine optimization strategy. Luckily, we’ve got you to help us guide our clients to the top of the search engines.
Social Media Manager. Social is just a piece of the puzzle when it comes to SEO, and you know just the way to vamp up your clients’ social media entities.
Reputation Manager. Reviews are critical for our clients’ success, so at Spectrum you will work to manage and improve your clients’ online reputation.
Required Skills and Experience
We’re looking for Digital Marketing Account Management team members who have:
A Bachelor’s Degree in marketing, business, or a related field
Knowledge and firsthand experience with the search marketing industry
At least 2 years of professional SEO/SEM experience
Experience in dealing directly with clients, ideally B2C clients
Project management experience
Company branding and messaging experience
Familiarity and prior experience with website architecture/build in regards to digital marketing best practices
Some PPC management experience
A fundamental understanding of HTML and CSS
An ability to understand and develop performance reports using Google Analytics Data
Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written
Google AdWords Certification a plus
Google Analytics Certification a plus
Benefits
Being the dynamite Digital Marketing Account Manager that you are, we understand that in order to stay fresh all day you need a good work-life-play balance. To make sure that’s possible this full-time position comes with a highly competitive salary and unparalleled benefits including:
Comprehensive medical & dental insurance
Retirement planning & company matching
Generous PTO, including sick days & holidays
A state-of-the-art office environment
Year-round gym memberships
Paid continuing education
Casual dress code
Flexible scheduling
Free-Lunch-Friday
Company sponsored parties and group activities outside of the office
Apply for our Digital Marketing Consultant positions and feel your impact with Spectrum today.
INDSPCI

Title: Senior Analyst - Accounting
Descriptions:
802 Delaware Avenue (18052), United States of America, Wilmington, Delaware
Senior Analyst - Accounting

We are looking for a Senior Analyst to join a cross-functional team designed to deliver against corporate initiatives for multiple business lines. Your responsibilities will be associated with the implementation of corporate initiatives that have direct impacts to Controller systems and processes. You will utilize your systems and accounting industry knowledge as well as Agile experience. The Shared Systems team manages controls, analysis and system configuration changes for our general ledger, reconciliation, consolidations, external regulatory reporting and certification systems for the entire Controllers organization. The accuracy of these systems is essential to reporting correct financial information to our executives, regulators, and investors. In addition, you will have the ability to understand upstream and downstream processes that will impact these systems including line of business dependencies.

Primary Responsibilities:

Work with product owners and business to understand the requirements and how those requirements impact current configuration
Understand financial system value stream
Understand the high-level design, configuration design and set up of the systems we support
Participate in peer review and release review meetings to ensure adherence to best practices and standards
Work with tech partners to understand configuration impact of coding changes
Complete system/application configuration changes
Communicate implementation details to user community
Comply and stay current with configuration and testing processes and standards
Recommend changes or modifications to the existing processes and standards
Provide support for post-implementation processes and systems during warranty period; troubleshoot with tech
Maintain up-to-date understanding of projects that have a configuration impact. This includes activities, risks and issues, assumptions and dependencies
Agile performer duties and responsibilities required by Capital One

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree or military experience
At least 1 year of Accounting or Financial Services experience

Preferred Qualifications:
At least 1 year experience in an Agile Environment
At least 1 year of experience with PeopleSoft Financials System or another large financial system (Oracle or SAP)
At least 1 year of experience working on projects using an Agile framework, preferably Scrum
At least 1 year of experience using Jira
At least 1 year of experience Tableau and AWS
At least 1 year of experience using SQL
