Title: Sr. Financial Planning Analyst
Descriptions:
Overview:
The Senior Financial Planning Analyst provides financial planning and analysis to drive financial performance and help Bix Produce achieve its business goals. This includes collaboration with and analytical support for cross-functional business teams, key player in Company planning processes, evaluation of financial actual results compared to plans or forecasts, analytical support for growth opportunities (new products, acquisition) and leveraging technology to create better analytical tools.

BIX Produce is an Equal Opportunity Employer
Responsibilities:
Business team FP&A support.
Financial planning and analysis support for sales and operations including customer, product, channel, operations, and delivery analysis / profitability helping team members understand the financial impact of decisions.
Drive and monitor financial performance, analyze and interpret operating results, investigate variances and evaluate their effect on operations.
Provide forecasting and analysis support/recommendations to achieve planned financial performance.
Analyze pricing changes to quantify projected impact on volume and margins.
Enhance current processes and reporting mechanics to promote a more data-driven culture.
Assist with other cross functional initiatives as necessary.
Lead and/or support planning and forecasting processes:
Establish and lead the annual operating plan cycle, quarterly progress reporting and financial reforecast process. Includes project management of overall process - timeline of key milestones and tasks, ensuring deadlines are met.
Execute the financial planning and budgeting process including income statement, balance sheet, and cash flow forecasting.
Ensure cross-functional coordination of budgeting, forecasting, reporting, and cost improvement efforts.
Interpret financial results and develop financial models to identify strategic alternatives and/or contingency plans.
Participate in 3-year strategic planning process and modeling.
Develop monthly and annual business metrics/KPIs/scorecard for internal management and board communication.
Manage demand forecasting process, continuous process improvement, measurement of forecast accuracy, and oversight of execution.
Responsible for leading internal and external reporting, such as monthly performance, monthly forecasts, and analysis.
Assist CFO with preparation of Board / Management reporting package, analysis of variance, identification of key drivers/insights, outlook/re-forecast.
Conduct analysis and modeling of business development opportunities (e.g., acquisitions, new channel, new customer, co-branding, licensing projects, etc.).
Assist in the development of policies and processes for financial operations control and reporting in the area of budgeting, financial planning, forecasting, cost control and capital investments, etc.
Utilizes data warehouse and reporting tools to manipulate data set outputs into executive level analyses for decision making.
Participate in system improvements including ERP optimization, reporting tools development, etc.
Maintain a safe working environment to reduce injuries and workers compensation claims.
Food Safety as it relates to this position.
All other duties assigned.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, or related business degree
Minimum of eight years of relevant finance experience to include 5 plus years financial planning and analysis.
Demonstrated financial planning/analysis skills within a high growth, evolving company environment.
Strong attention to detail and analytical skills.
Systems orientation, including management reporting and financial transactions processing.
Excellent planning and analysis skills with the ability to analyze situation, apply proven problem-solving techniques and make sound decisions/recommendations.
Business acumen-strong business analysis and judgment, ability to understand cost/value equations.
Creative - ability to recommend new processes, new data management/analysis methods, etc.
Self-starter – inquisitive, high energy, results driven.
Fast-paced growing company experience and/or demonstrated effectiveness in a small company / location where role includes both strategic and hands-on responsibilities.
Demonstrated leader who brings a strong cross-functional partnering approach and general management perspective.
Experienced in use of metrics / scorecard to measure and manage performance.
Demonstrated process improvement/simplification expertise.
Cross-functional understanding and ability to achieve business results through cross-functional collaboration with of sales, finance, operations, customer service, HR and vendor partners.
Effective written communication, presentation skills, and influencing skills both internally and externally.
Strong MS Office skills (mastery level Excel). Experienced in utilizing BI tools, ERP system/reporting to complete complex business / decision analysis and planning.
Planning and prioritization skills including strong project management background.
Adaptable, resilient, flexible, fast-paced/sense of urgency, and a high level of multitasking ability.
Demonstrated passion and personal commitment.
Personal and professional values aligned with company values and culture, high integrity.

Title: BCBA/Clinical Coordinator-New Milford
Descriptions:
Aspire Living & Learning is helping individuals live their best lives. We are seeking a full time entry level Behavior Analyst/Clinical Coordinator to work in our School consultation division in New Milford, CT. The ideal candidate will either be enrolled in their Master's Program or be a Board Certified Behavior Analyst
The Behavior Analyst will be responsible for daily management of assigned caseload and ongoing training and implementation of Behavior Plans for children who have been outplaced to our program due to social, behavioral, and/or academic needs.
What you'll do:
Provide ongoing training the implementation of all assessment, intervention, and instructional procedures
Conduct Functional Behavior Assessments and Functional Analyses and develops function based interventions
Analyze data and make data based decisions about progress and programming
Works cooperatively with stakeholders and participates in informational meetings as required.
Participate and evaluate needs for referrals.
Provide ongoing training for the behavior therapists including universal behavioral strategies across settings, behavior reduction strategies, and reinforcement systems.
Writes assessment and IP reports as needed.
Attend committee meetings as required by stakeholders such as PRC, HRC, and URR.
Provide ongoing training in Positive Behavior Supports.
Teach, facilitate, and monitor communication systems for multiple individuals.
What we're looking for:
Actively enrolled in a Behavior Analytic Master's Program or be a Board Certified Behavior Analyst
At least 3 years exemplary performance in Behavior Therapy with another ABA provider
Excellent interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills
Valid drivers license and safe driving record
If you want to join us in making a difference and positively impact the lives of others while charting your own path of development, then we at the Aspire team would love to hear from you.
Covid-19 Consideration
Please note that Aspire Living & Learning has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and individuals we support. As a condition of employment, employees are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless an exemption is approved for medical or religious reason or as otherwise required by law.
Aspire Living & Learning believes it must play an active role in creating a community of employees that is diverse, inclusive and equitable. Our work benefits greatly from the contributions of people of color, people from working class backgrounds, women, LGBTQ people, and individuals with disabilities. Hence, we strongly encourage applications from people with these identities or who are members of other marginalized communities.

Title: Revenue Cycle Denials Analyst
Descriptions:
Schedule: Monday - Friday 9 am to 5 pm
Salary: $22 - $26 per hour
The Revenue Cycle Denials Analyst iscoordinates the analysis and effective resolution of denied claims with the purpose of reducing overall denials and increasing revenue. The Revenue Cycle Denials Analyst is responsible for prioritizing and managing to resolution denied claims with government and third party payers.
Responsibilities include:
Interpreting payment and denial data down to the line item detail
identifying payer and coding trends, risks, and opportunities, and to implement operational and/or systematic improvements.
Researches, develops, and maintains a solid understanding of payer requirements, including filing limit, claim processing logic, coordination of benefits requirements, patient responsibility and authorization requirements.
Triages denied claims to identify appropriate action to ensure timely processing and payment.
Performs ongoing analysis to determine the root cause of denials and proactively alert management to issues and trends.
Proactively makes recommendations for workflow, operational, and/or systemic changes to reduce denials and speed up collections.
Develops and modifes tracking and reporting process for denials, appeals status and appeals results. Ensures that all denials are tracked and the appeals are monitored accordingly
Performs other duties as required.
Why Vinfen?
We are committed to you! We offer great training, great benefits, career growth and job security!
Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance for employees working 30 hours or more
15 days of Vacation, 12 Paid Holidays, 10 Sick Days and 3 Personal Days per year (for employees scheduled for 20 hours or more)
Education Assistance and Tuition Remission Programs as well as innovative Student Loan Payment Programs. Employment with Vinfen counts toward your Public Student Loan Forgiveness eligibility
Professional Development programs including year-round online training courses and opportunities to earn CEUs
Retirement savings programs, including a fully funded, employer sponsored retirement plan and an employee funded 403 (b) plan
Company paid Life, Accidental Death & Dismemberment and Long-Term Disability Insurance
Voluntary Term, Whole Life, Accident and Critical Care Insurance
Flexible Spending Reimbursement Accounts (Health and Dependent care)
$500 -- $1,000+ Employee Referral Bonuses with no annual cap!
Other generous benefits including discounted memberships, access to wellness programs and more!
About Us
Founded in 1977, for over 40 years Vinfen has been a leading nonprofit human services organization that "transforms lives" by building the capacity of individuals, families, organizations and communities to learn, thrive and achieve their goals. Vinfen supports thousands of adolescents and adults with psychiatric, developmental and behavioral disabilities at more than 200 sites with over 3,000 employees in eastern Massachusetts and Connecticut. www.vinfen.org/careers
My Vinfen. My Community. My Job.

Title: Behavioral Health Professional: Multiple schedules available!
Descriptions:
Become part of our dynamic team and increase your skill sets by working closely with knowledgeable, well-rounded clinicians in the fields of Applied Behavior Analysis and Speech-Language Pathology! This is an excellent position for those looking to further their education and gain valuable experience.
Hammond Associates (est 1989) provides Speech-language Pathology, Audiology, and Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) services to individuals throughout the state of Maine. We are expanding services to our clients, and are looking for experienced and talented Behavioral Health Professionals to work alongside our Executive Director and Clinical Director, ABA Services in clinic, home, school and community settings.
The successful candidate will have previous experience working in school, community, and clinic settings. The candidate will acquire a good working knowledge of the principles and practices of ABA, as well the ability to demonstrate these principles to others. Strong organizational skills, people skills, and time management capabilities are essential elements to being successful in this role.
Basic Function
Provide direct 1:1 services as are written in the Individualized Treatment Plan and Behavior Management Plan of Hammond Associates’ clients in clinic, home, school and community settings.
Must be at least 18 years of age.
Have a high school diploma or equivalent. Some college credit preferred.
Exemplary written and verbal communication skills.
Ability and willingness to work a flexible schedule including evenings and weekends.
Must be an American citizen or maintain legal alien status.
Must have a valid State of Maine driver’s license and ability and willingness to travel.
Must not have any major moving violations.
Responsibilities
Maintain a high level of ethical behavior and confidentiality.
Complete all training requirements within established time frames.
Meet with assigned Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) for supervision.
Complete and turn in necessary paperwork for the position on a daily basis.
Explicitly follow plans written by the treatment team.
Place the needs of the individual first.
Provide high quality one-on-one instruction to the individual.
Have the ability and composure to handle moderate to severe problem behaviors exhibited by the individual client in accordance to the Behavior Management Plan.
Attend all sessions as scheduled.
Document data according to the specific plan as described by the BCBA.
Other duties as requested by the supervisor.'

Title: Clinic ABA Paraprofessional
Descriptions:
**Do you love children and are passionate about helping children with special needs?*
The ABA Paraprofessional will work under the supervision of the Clinical Supervisor to provide in clinic highly individualized ABA services to children and their families, as well as additional hours spent at the office.

Job Description:
Maintain positive attitude and rapport at all times during work
Provide direct 1:1 and/or small group services in clinic setting
Carry out individualized treatment plans as directed by the Clinical Supervisor and/or Student Analyst
May run discrete trial training and/or Natural Environment Training sessions
Assist with activities of daily living
Model appropriate social and play skills
Collect ongoing data to track child's progress
Follow specified goals and accommodations per child's individual goals as directed by BCBA or other treatment team members
Attend and participate in relevant trainings and meetings
Work collaboratively with parents, the Clinical Supervisor, Treatment Coordinator and other professionals
Maintain appropriate ethical boundaries with family members at all times
Assist in training new direct care workers
Take ongoing data on all aspects of treatment
Maintain current and ongoing documentation of all activities
Create individual or group therapeutic and educational materials as requested by other members of the team
Participate in the development in instructional procedures
Assist in maintaining appearance of the FBS office/clinics
Enter all timesheet information into Practice Management Software
Other tasks, as directed by supervisors and leads

Title: Behavioral Technician
Descriptions:
Company Description
Everything we do is focused on a single goal: making a difference in children’s lives.
**NO EXPERIENCE REQUIRED, **FREE RBT TRAINING** **$200 Bonus upon completion of RBT certification!
ATG is looking for a dedicated and compassionate behavioral technician to join our team and provide Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) services to children with Autism Spectrum Disorders. Behavior technicians are responsible for assisting behavior analysts to implement behavior reduction and skill acquisition treatment plans. The candidate will assist patients with day to day activities, monitor their behavior, record and collect data on patients' progress, and communicate with clients. Other duties may include clerical and administrative duties.
To be successful in this role, you will display a compassionate nature, empathy and discretion in your work. You should have excellent communication and time management skills, and be able to develop and maintain relationships with clients, supervisors and colleagues. Prior experience in a behavioral health setting is advantageous.
A fully trained RBT therapist can receive, on average, 10-20 hours/week with each session lasting 2 - 4 hours.
Perks of joining the ATG Team:
Ability to work within the hours of 8 am - 8 pm
Road map for professional growth opportunities
Annual reviews of your performance & compensation
Monthly raffle with prizes valued up to $250!
Clinical mentorship
Bonus opportunities, including employee referrals & RBT certification!
Be a part of a company that is Great Places to Work certified and BCHOE accredited
and more!
Specific responsibilities include:
Provide direct care to clients in a one-on-one or group therapy setting to implement skill acquisition and behavior reduction treatments as directed by the supervisor.
Collect and record data on patient behavior.
Collaborate, communicate and assist with the training of clients, parents and staff.
Provide a safe and supportive environment for patients and family.
Carry out clinical assessments and other administrative duties.
Maintain strict confidentiality.
Attend training to acquire further knowledge.
Please click here to watch a video that shows a typical session between a Behavioral Therapist and client: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-UIrOZkYmO4
Qualifications
Certificate, Bachelor’s or Associate’s Degree in a behavioral health or related field (preferred).
Obtain RBT Certification within the first 45-days of employment - all costs and supervision for this certification are paid by ATG.
Additional certification may be required - all costs will be paid by ATG.
Relevant experience preferred.
Strong interpersonal skills.
Computer skills.
Reliable vehicle, valid driver’s license and proof of auto insurance
Essential Job Functions
Able to provide consistent attention and care for the client, up to 4 hour long sessions
Ability to sustain long periods of sitting or standing
Excellent communications skills to effectively interact with patients
Ability to bend, squat, lift, and lower a minimum of 20 pounds (must be able to lift and carry clients)
Must be able to have flexible scheduling
Ability to communicate with your team through phone and email in a timely manner
Required to have reliable technology to complete online training
Additional Information
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Pay: $20.00 - $21.00 per hour

Title: Behavior Consultant (BCBA/ BCaBA required)
Descriptions:
We're looking for highly qualified BCBAs (or BCaBAs) to join our specialized team at Principled Behavior Consultants.
Do you value working for a company that is values-oriented and maintains a commitment to ethics while delivering high-quality behavior services?
Does the idea of working a flexible schedule with low weekly billable hour requirements pique your interest? At PBC we only hire behavior analysts as consultants and do not utilize services of direct care staff (RBTs). This frees up our consultants to focus their time and efforts on completing assessments, analyzing treatment effects, and training parents/staff .
Are you hoping to be part of a strong clinical team? At PBC, both team members and leadership cultivate a friendly, highly collaborative, supportive, and flexible work environment.
Have you considered the benefits of being part of a strong term while simultaneously having the flexibility and freedom to take initiative in growing the services in your own region?
About us:
The mission of Principled Behavior Consultants is to provide the highest quality of behavior analytic consultation services available. Our commitment to our clients is one built on trust, respect, and collaboration. The foundation of our services is informed by research on behavior analytic assessment and treatment. Our focus is on the ethical delivery of individualized services that are practical for our clients and their stakeholders.
Here at Principled Behavior Consultants, the name “Principled” was chosen for two reasons: One, it reminds us that the use of behavioral “principles” is a core part of our services provided; That the company sticks to the fundamentals of behavior and doesn’t use untested treatments or those that are not evidence-based; and two, it suggests high integrity, values-oriented, and a commitment to ethics.
Fulfills responsibilities by demonstrating the following:
Consult on cases with appropriate frequency
Sets a client consult schedule (weekly, bi-weekly, monthly, or as needed)
Follows up with clients whenever contacted
Develops client goals
Align with Assessment data
Reviews data and monitors client progress
Selects practical and useful measures to track
Keep graphs up to date
Behavioral approach to intervention
Data for all problem behavior identified for reduction
Functions identified
Replacement behaviors identified
Makes Program Updates as needed
Ongoing evaluation of goals as data and ongoing assessment indicates
Provides Staff, Teacher, and Caretaker training
Goals are identified and quantified
Use Behavioral Skills Training protocol
Written feedback notes
Seeks supervision and participates in professional development
Interactions with co-workers are professional and productive
Focus is on objective observations, identification of problem, positive actions to take to resolve issues
Maintains professional and respectful boundaries in conversations.
Required Education, Experience, and Qualifications:
BCaBA or BCBA Certification from the BACB® and Licensed by the Board of Medicine in the State of Virginia.
Demonstrate a thorough understanding of applied behavior analytic strategies for assessment and treatment.
A minimum of three years' experience working directly with clients with Autism and/or developmental delays.
Team-oriented
Engaging and personable
Motivated to help people
Interested in learning
Passionate about behavior analysis
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $45,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year
Benefits:

Flexible schedule
Health insurance
Life insurance
Paid time off
Professional development assistance
Relocation assistance

BCBA or BCaBA (Required)

25% (Preferred)

Title: Behavior Technician
Company: Journey Autism and Behavioral Care Centers
Descriptions:
Are you an ABA professional or interested in pursuing a career in ABA and seeking a company that invests in its team and clients?
We have immediate openings for professionals seeking a career in behavior analysis who are dedicated to making a meaningful difference for clients diagnosed with Autism Spectrum Disorder.
*Please note that the clients in Brookline are seeking a part time tech
Why join Journey Autism Centers? We offer:
Exciting career path with opportunities for promotions and long-term growth in the field
A competitive pay structure ranging from $27-$34 per hour, with opportunities for pay increases and bonuses based on development milestones, tenure, and hours worked
Paid for sessions cancelled by the client (if they cannot be rescheduled and no additional assignments are available).
Extended BCBA support and supervision up to 15-20% monthly
Company sponsored health, dental and vision benefits for full time employees who work a minimum of 30 hours per week
Paid training, including completion of the RBT training course (if needed)
Professional development funds, covering the cost of items such as the RBT exam, BACB certification, and ongoing trainings
Mileage reimbursement
Paid (optional) monthly support meetings (including Journal Club and ABA best practice dissemination led by our VP of operations). These meetings also give aspiring BCBAs an opportunity to earn unrestricted clinical hours
Flexible schedules based on your availability
Paid time off (vacation and sick)
A company-provided mobile phone and voice/data plan (to help maintain work/life balance)
Free supervision, practicum, and mentoring for aspiring BCBAs from our dedicated team of close and collaborative professionals
Transparency through our employee referral program, giving you the opportunity to reach out to our staff and ask questions before you accept an offer.
Journey Autism and Behavioral Care Centers was founded by our VP of Clinical Operations, a BCBA-D, whose vision is that truly excellent clinical care can only be achieved with truly excellent people who deserve quality training, support, and development throughout their career. Our vision is to grow ABA through quality and ethical practice. Our company’s team and culture continue to be built on this foundation, and everyone on our team is passionate about ABA and changing the lives of families impacted by Autism Spectrum Disorder.
Full Job Description:
Under the direction of a Board Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA), Behavior Techs (BTs) and Registered Behavior Technicians (RBTs) are responsible for the direct implementation of skill-acquisition and behavior-reduction plans and will also collect data and conduct certain types of assessments (such as stimulus preference assessments). We are seeking dedicated, passionate, and driven ABA professionals to work with our clients.
What to expect after applying:
We are inviting you to interview us, as much as we are interviewing you! Our Clinical Recruiter (a previous RBT with an MS in ABA) will invite you to connect with her for an interview. Then she will connect you to current BCBAs and Behavior Technicians to ask direct questions about what we are all about! Don’t be shy, we encourage all our staff to collaborate with us in an effort to continually improve services and the field of ABA. Our team is here to offer insight and help you decide if Journey, and the field of ABA, is right for you.
Qualifications Required and Job Responsibilities:
Required Availability - Weekday hours in the afternoon (after school)
Preferred Availability - Flexibility for weekend hours as available
High school diploma or general education degree (GED); and one-year related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience
Ability to obtain Registered Behavior Technician credential within 60 days of hire (we pay for the 40-hour training)
Previous experience with children and/or adolescents, personal and/or professional experience with autism, the field of ABA, or any adjacent field
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Must have valid ID and reliable transportation
Ability to read and interpret documents
Ability to utilize Microsoft Word, Excel and an online ABA software data collection system
Must be fully COVID vaccinated
Preferred Qualifications:
Registered Behavior Technician certification
Direct experience working with children in a 1:1 setting
1-year ABA experience
Work Location:
Multiple locations (we offer in-home services, so the location is dependent upon the client)
*We do not show a preference for or discourage someone from applying for a job because of his or her race, color, religion, sex (including gender identity, sexual orientation, and pregnancy), national origin, age, disability or genetic information.

Pay: $27.00 - $34.00 per hour with based on experience and hours worked per week.

Title: ABA Therapist (Part-time) - Larchmont, NY
Descriptions:
Title: ABA Therapist
Classification: Employee, Part-Time, In-Person, Hourly, Non-Exempt
Hours: 10 hours/week: Mon, Wed, Fri 6pm-8pm; Sat & Sun 9am-11am
Location: Larchmont, NY; See Open Cases here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1v4NRYjXb5_gEKs1s4fmLqh32jLJL3snh6pHLuf_waQ8/edit#bookmark=id.wtr7hycd1tul
Hourly Rate: $22-$31 per hour
Pay Frequency: Biweekly
Reports To: LBA Case Supervisor
Position Summary
ABA Therapists (also known as Behavior Technicians, or Registered Behavior Technicians or RBTs) are responsible for providing one-on-one mental health services based on the principles of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) to children and adolescents on the Autism Spectrum in order to improve their behaviors across settings. ABA Therapists/RBTs work under the supervision and guidance of a New York Licensed Behavior Analyst (NY-LBA) in concert with teachers, parents, guardians, families, counselors, and other professionals to implement a client’s prescribed treatment plan and transfer skills to the client's primary caregivers.
What we offer
$22-31/hr, distributed in biweekly payrolls
Paid sick leave (1 hour for every 30 hours worked, up to 40 hours annually)
Participation in 401(k) and 3% company contribution after 12 months of employment & 1,000 hours with availability to enter the plan in January and July after meeting eligibility requirements
Cancellation pay when families cancel sessions last minute
Flexible schedule
Free training to obtain RBT credential
Professional development/supervision on an ongoing basis
Training beyond the task list on topics such as Client Dignity, Ableism, & Assent
Free monthly professional development webinars
Experience in the rewarding field of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA)
Student practicum placement and qualified supervision for psychology, social work, and other undergraduate and graduate programs
Opportunities to grow with our family of companies (MPA, MPG & MPG Tutoring)
Position Responsibilities
Provide direct ABA therapy in home, school, and community settings
Implement treatment plans developed by Licensed Behavior Analysts (LBAs)
Develop rapport, communicate effectively, and collaborate with LBAs/Board Certified Behavior Analysts (BCBAs) and other professionals and/or family members involved with the client’s treatment
Collect behavioral data as directed by the LBA/BCBA using data collection software on company-issued device
Complete and submit appropriate, accurate clinical notes per each session in a timely manner according to agency policy
Participate in ongoing in-house training and professional development on topics that include foundational ABA techniques, ableism, client dignity, and assent.
Position Qualifications
Minimum of 2 years of post-secondary education in one of the following disciplines preferred: behavior science, early childhood education, special education, human services, psychology, or related field
1-2 years of ABA experience is strongly preferred
Experience working with neurodiverse children and adolescents with developmental diagnoses is preferred
Successful completion of NY Mandated Reporter Training
Current CPR Certification
Hold a current RBT certification or complete free online training program (40 hours) to obtain RBT certification, if needed for case
Flexibility and availability during scheduled hours, which may include evenings and weekends
Passion for working with children and adolescents with developmental disabilities
Ability to develop and maintain professional relationships with clients, co-workers, supervisors, and community members
Ability to adhere to organizational policies and procedures and abide by code of ethics as indicated by the Behavior Analyst Certification Board
Commitment to maintain client confidentiality and adhere to business associate agreement and HIPAA laws
Ability to communicate effectively and collaboratively, both written and verbal
Ability to implement established treatment plan with integrity, including goals and activities
Ability to navigate data collection software on tablet or other tech device
Ability to shift priorities and adjust execution of treatment plan based on feedback provided by LBA
Ability to think on your feet and creatively engage clients while implementing treatment plan
A drive to learn and grow in the rewarding field of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA)
Position Conditions
must be able to work in the NYC metro area in locations of the candidate's choice in the Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens, or other locations
must be physically present at the assigned job location, including homes, schools, and community placements
must be willing and able to travel between different job sites
must be able to sit on the floor, stand for extended periods of time, lift, and carry weight, not to exceed 50 pounds
must be able to assume and maintain a variety of postures, including kneeling, squatting, crawling, sitting, and standing for extended periods of time

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. Alternatively, email requests can be sent to accommodationrequest[at]manhattanpsychologygroup.com.

Title: Sr Tax Analyst
Descriptions:
UGI Energy Services supplies and markets natural gas, liquid fuels, and electricity to 42,000 customer locations across the Mid-Atlantic and Northeastern US.
We are a supplier, marketer, and midstream services provider – one backed by 135 years of natural gas experience, plus our own expanding energy infrastructure. Along with buying and selling energy commodities at the wholesale level, UGIES owns and operates key electric generation and midstream natural gas assets throughout Pennsylvania.
With headquarters and supply sources near the heart of the Marcellus Shale, UGIES is well positioned to meet the changing energy demands of commercial, industrial, institutional, and government customers for years to come.

We offer comprehensive benefits, some of which are:
Paid Vacation time starts with 3 weeks off
8 Paid Holidays
Sick time
Short term & Long term disability
Medical plan options from Blue Cross
Vision coverage from Vision Service Provider
Dental coverage from United Concordia
Extended Maternity Leave - 8 weeks pay at 100% with the option of 2 more weeks paid at 100% or 4 weeks paid at 50%
Paternity Leave - 2 weeks pay at 100% or 4 weeks pay at 50%
Company provided 401K match of 100% of the employee's 6% contribution
Tuition Reimbursement of 80% of tuition costs capped at $6,300 per year
Job Summary
This position is responsible for providing support and assistance to the Senior Manager of Natural Gas Tax Accounting in executing the day-to-day income tax function for UGI Energy Services including but not limited to income tax provision, income tax compliance, and support for ad hoc projects.
Duties and Responsibilities
Assist the Sr. Manager of Natural Gas Tax Accounting with accounting for income taxes in accordance with ASC740 which includes:
Preparation of the quarterly and year-end effective tax rate and income tax entries.
Entry of year-end data into tax provision software.
Reconciliation of tax related accounts.
Preparation of the tax basis balance sheet study.
Preparation of the provision to return calculations.
Preparation of quarterly estimated tax calculations.
Lead the preparation of tax packages for submission to UGI Corporate Tax for the filing of federal and state income tax returns. Enter tax data in tax compliance software to support UGI Corporate Tax in the preparation of the consolidated tax return.
Manage tax depreciation in Power Tax.
Calculate monthly tax accruals for all UGI Energy Services entities.
Assist in income tax research. Maintain schedule of all income taxes, income filings and income tax procedures and policies.
Assist with ad hoc projects or process improvement initiatives.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
Knowledge of tax compliance and reporting requirements and deadlines.
Familiar with income tax accounting, generally accepted accounting principles, and SOX to perform key controls over financial reporting.
Prior work with corporate tax group or tax accounting firm.
Ability to independently understand preparing tax filings and support based on following prior year.
Ability to work across disciplines such as payroll, accounts payable, fixed assets and general accounting to gather information.
Ability to navigate ERP systems. SAP a plus.
Must have working knowledge Microsoft Office Suites.
Performs under minimal supervision.
OneSource Tax Provision (OTP) experience.
Education and Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting preferred.
5+ years of tax experience in Corporate or Public accounting environment.
CPA credentials is a plus.
UGI Energy Services, is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. The Company does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, sex, national origin, disability, age, gender identity, veteran status, or any other legally protected class in its practices.
